Reviews.Title: “Room was Okay”
Reviews.Author: Lovingfreedom
Reviews.Content: We were so-so about this resort. The pool looked dingy and dirty, but may have been partly due to the overcast weather and color that it's sealed with. The kiddy pool and hot tub looked better. Rooms were spacious and having a full kitchen was really great but make sure you bring/buy all your supplies from soap to paper towels to dish scrubbers - they do not provide anything. Don't take the sheets off the beds - the mattresses were really, really nasty!! The beds squeaked every time you sat on them or moved around. No room service at all. We had a small patio with chairs which was really nice to relax at night. JJ, the bartender is the BEST!!! He makes some mean drinks and was very entertaining. The Tiki hut is small but JJ is worth stopping by. Lots of parking available. No restaurants, snacks or "must have" items in the resort. TV's were 2nd rate at best and not many channels available. We got a really good rate on the room and we basically got what we paid for. I would stay there again if I received the same rate, but will go better prepared next time. If you want a place where they clean the room daily and you get clean sheets and towels, forget about staying at this place. There were 4 adults in our room, though, and for the money we paid, it was worth it. Unfortunately, Mike Ditka's Resot has definitely gone downhill over the past couple of years.

Reviews.Title: “Runaway.... the title says it all!!”
Reviews.Author: Laura S
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to Mike Ditka's resort. The 1st was in 2007, Great stay then. This location has really gone down hill, Mike Ditka should take his name off of it since he has apparently sold it. We arrived early at 11:30 am and were told our room was not ready, BUT, if we wanted to pay 1/2 a day rate we could check in right away. We decided to go for lunch, since we had been traveling since 4am, what was a few more hours?? After shopping for our food supply needs, we returned to the off-site check in location down the street at 3:15pm to again be told "Sorry, come back at 4pm". BUT, the clerk gave us some wrist bands to use the pool while we waited. How Nice! At 4:10, we Finally got our room, (the check in location was filled with many angry visitors.) Arrival to our room in the 8000 building, (even though I requested the 2000 or 3000 close to the pool for the children), it was clear this was NOT in the same star rating as it was a few years earlier!! The room smelled damp, air conditioner not cooling (common complaint among guests), bed covering dirty and old, pillows flat, pool towels NOT provided unlike previous visit, (what hotel doesn't provide pool towels??) Check out pic's for other lovely perks! We were on the main floor, the people above us liked to preform the River Dance at all hours!! Absolutely no insulation. And lastly, do NOT use the washing machine at night, especially if you have sleeping children, louder than a plane taking off!!! We paid WAY too much for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Trying out the Mike Ditka resorts for the first time”
Reviews.Author: Eenyart
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to expect from the Mike Ditka resorts at first. The main bed didn't have a fitted sheet, only a flat sheet and it rolled up when you slept. There were limited towels which never dried in the humidity and the furniture is huge. The chairs and tables are very high, which was fine but a little odd as if we were all 7 foot basketball players. The website had promised they had groceries you could order. This was a total lie. We got there after several emails back and forth to an agent and no groceries and no one had ever heard of the service. We then had to walk about a 1/2 mile to a Walmart over highways (no real walking path) to get groceries as there are no restaurants close enough to walk to and you would need to walk highways to get to them. The main entrance was apparently under construction or falling apart. There was a very random front lobby not being used with ripped wallpaper, dirty carpets, and an old ice cream freezer. The water in the hotel smelled like a fishtank and made the towels smell the same. There was nothing to use in the condo, no paper towels, napkins, or toilet paper. We had to buy everything ourselves, and walk to Walmart on several occasions. The taxis had no idea where we were or how to get to us, and no one had ever heard of the Mike Ditka resorts anywhere we went. The only redeeming quality to this place was the price. So if you go in just thinking of this place as a cheap place to stay, and you plan on getting everything you need on your own then it's fine. It's not a hotel in any sense, and you receive no service what so ever and are suppose to account for all of your supplies yourself. The staff seems confused and unhappy to be there and were not helpful at all. The shuttle service to Disney is few and far between, and often overcrowded and they they expected tips on top of it. They also make several stops so getting to Disney takes an hour instead of 10 minutes. You have to go in every morning and sign up for the shuttle to Disney, which is a hassle and requires a lot of extra time and a long walk from the condos. The pool is ok, but often filled with many people who don't follow any rules what-so-ever. The kids were running, jumping in with regular clothes, some adults were drinking at the pool and hot tub. Lots of yelling and splashing and throwing toys around disturbing every other guests and this took place every night of the 5 we were there. It's obvious people catch on that the place is not monitored at all, and no one makes the guests follow any type of rules. You are suppose to supervise the kids and get a bracelet to get in the pool area but no one does. The nightly movie never happened and the Tiki Bar was closed all of the time. The gym is overcrowded with kids playing basketball indoors and the workout room is very basic. They do not have a restaurant or any other amenities that a hotel would, and a small vending machine for pop only. The TV is very low quality with almost no channels, no cable for sure and a DVD player if you happened to bring a bunch of movies with you (or buy them at your lovely 1/2 walk to Walmart). I wish I had known more about this place before going. If you are looking for a cheap building to sleep in, this place if for you. If you are looking for a hotel that you are comfortable and happy in and don't have to be stressed out every day..this is not the place for you. I have no idea where the other guests who reviewed this place stayed, because this is not the same place.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: BurlingtonCarioca2
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Mike Ditke Resort was truly enjoyable. we highly recommend this resort to everyone with families. The friendly staff and the accomodations are truly exceptional. The kids loved the pool and the rooms. We are definattely coming back. Wish could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, and close to many attractions!”
Reviews.Author: ChiefPontiac
Reviews.Content: This is more of a Condo and pool type place. Not a "Resort" with activities, Tiki Bar, and property that makes you want to stay around the place most days. It is basic. But a newer and clean basic so don't shy away esecially if you get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Missing it Already”
Reviews.Author: Up-Here-In-The-Cold
Reviews.Content: Truthfully, every time we get to Florida we have arrived from a very cold place so i will admit to always being in a super mood at any check in. We always stay at Runaway Beach Club and this time especially was nothing short of a delight and as always the management and services people were friendly, helpful and of course professional. From check in to check our stay was yet again is the time that will help us get through until the next time. Thanks Beach Club for doing such a great job in running such a fine facility.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: escaledelady
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have taken our grand kids to Mike Ditka Resort for the last 4 years and returned again for their spring break this year in March. We have always enjoyed our stay and did so again. The grand kids look forward to come back again next year. The rooms are huge with all the amenities that we need. We typically stay in the three bedrooms condo, so the kids get their own bedroom. They truly enjoy the pool after a busy day at Disney, which is great for us, as we can rest while they swim before dinner. We just like to say thank you for making our vacation a memorable one year after year.

Reviews.Title: “I miss the old Mike Ditka”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany J
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this resort many times in the past 3 years and was completely disappointed when I arrived for my family vacation last month. I did receive the email about the off-site check-in. I didn't let this upset me too much... although if I had known sooner than a week before my check-in, I would have stayed somewhere else! Our unit was clean and comfortable, as always... but management makes a much bigger difference! When we arrived, I felt super uncomfortanle walking into the back of a building late at night, not knowing what awaited me inside. The young gentleman at the "make-shift" desk only knew to check my ID and hand me a room key. When I asked about our crib/pack & play, I was told that they could not find one from when I called the day before. I asked him why no one called me to let me know? If they had my email to let me know about the off-site check-in, they clearly had my contact info. I was extremely dissapointed about no management being onsite... we had to wash our own room towels during our 5 day stay! I could not believe it! And the only excuse for everything was "There has been a change in management..." When my husband asked if we could have a late check-out (as we have done everytime we stayed at the resort) he was told that he would have to call first thing in the morning to request it. When he called at 7 am the morning of check-out, he was told that we had to check-out at the time designated... It did not feel like a family vacation as it did in the past years... what a shame...

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: Maxxxxx
Reviews.Content: We didn't get the email about the off site check in. The office was in back of a strip mall by a dumpster. I called to report the shower curtain was coming down, we need toilet tissue, tissues etc., but one one ever came. The unit was very dated. The management is no longer Mike Ditka and there is no one on site who help with anything. When we went to the office behind the dumpster to check out, the office was empty. It looked like they had a flood! After a run around, we were told by a maintence man to drive down the street and look for a white Dodge van, with a housekeeper named Chandra. We gave her the keys and she said she would send an email receipt. We never received it. Our stay was not enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: MandiJohansen
Reviews.Content: I don't know what happened to this place. I stayed here 2 years ago and it was great, and I have sent several people here, who loved it. The week I was due to arrive, I received an email that check-in would be off site. I had a lot of trouble finding it because it was behind a plaza in a dark parking area, that I was actually nervous about being in. I should mention now that check out, was somewhere in another plaza, which made me feel like I was getting sent on a not very fun scavenger hunt. I made a reservation for 5 people, but we only had 4 pillows and two blankets. There was no front desk to get any extra items. Oh, and did I mention we had 1 roll of toilet paper, one 3 ounce bottle of shampoo/conditioner and two tiny bars of soap for 5 people for 4 nights. They also put us right next to the highway, even thought there were other empty units. I was so tired from running around trying to find the check-in area, and then my building and my blood pressure was so high, I couldn't wait for the guy who was going to come over to change our room (we waited a 1/2 hour and he never showed). Finally as I was packing up, I read in the packet they gave me that I was responsible for removing my trash, or I would be charged a fee!!! I am surprised I didn't have to vacuum and make the beds for the next guest! If I wanted to clean up, I could have stayed home. It is a shame, because my past experience here was really good! I am not sure if they are in bankruptcy, but something fishy was definitely going on!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot rate this place!”
Reviews.Author: Darr522
Reviews.Content: I stayed here four years ago & it was beautiful & wonderful! I have no idea what happened! I'm glad they did not allow me to bring my dog because I would have been fearful for his life! It is filthy! Sticky white patches on the rugs! Refridgerator looks like it has been to one too many frat parties! Shower curtain liners new but made of tissue paper. Bedspreads that a black light would have gotten worn out on! Oh, and let's not forget the wonders of nature to greet you upon your arrival to bark your instructions at you! I really hate to say this, but I did not hear of Mike Ditka's passing, so the only thing I am left to believe is that he is safely tucked away in a mental hospital somewhere to have allowed this to happen to a once very beautiful resort that bears his name!

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointed”
Reviews.Author: lizard848106
Reviews.Content: The shower did not work in the unit we rented, called the desk,and she did offer us a different unit to shower in, not to relocate,just shower, I told her no thanks,to much trouble,we would shower at the next place we were scheduled to stay. When i checked out I asked for maybe a small compinsation,and she flatly refused.Not very good customer relations here! Will never go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and old facilities, Cheap Management”
Reviews.Author: Jesica E
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 5 nights at the Beach club and really dont like this place. It failed all our expectations and the advertisement. The real room and club facilities are much worse than the pictures and the property probably havent been remodelled for the last 10 years. The room is small and smelly. Furnitures and facilities in the room and club house are much older and dirtier than we expected. Nothing as even close to "luxury" which they advertise. The air-conditioner was old, loud and didnt work properly. It was stuffy and hot in our room even in March weather. Management was cheap and services was bad. Make sure you bring our own toilet papers because all they provided for you is one roll then you're on your own. Might want to bring your hairdryer as well since ours was broken and we had to wait until maintenance workers come at 10am the next morning to fix it. On top of that, they charged you $11.3/night for "using club amenities" no matter whether you used it or not. This place is a scam. In short, if you prefer services, you'll do yourself tons of favor by stayting at a hotel where they provide breakfast, refill your toilet paper and fix your hairdryer rightaway. If you prefer space and cleanliness, rent a vacation home. We did it last year and should have done it again this year. we'll never be back to this place again

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: arkiegirl3773
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1bedroom, 1 bath condo in January 2012. Unfortunately, time did not allow us to enjoy the resort. We would head out early and come in late. Our condo was very nice and clean. We had a few issues with the air conditioner, light bulbs, not enough bedding for hide-a-bed, etc. but overall it was a great condo and we enjoyed out stay. There is NOTHING provided by the resort. You will need your own tp, The unit did have a washer and dryer--which was great. Our condo faced the lagoon area and it was beautiful. It is about 15 mins from Disney parks--there is a lot of traffic but you can take a toll road near by that helps.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! Do not go here!”
Reviews.Author: Nilda L
Reviews.Content: I'm going to keep it short and simple: Unprofessional and snobby attitude staff. Dirty rooms and floors. Farther from Disney than they claim to be (not worth it). Pay more and stay closer!!!! In the end yes, they are cheap and this is why you get what you pay for - CRAP!

Reviews.Title: “Beware college drunks!”
Reviews.Author: Charles N
Reviews.Content: Kept awake from 2:30am till 5am on a Monday night from noisy college kids drinking, yelling, running around, jumping in lagoon etc. Lone desk staff on duty refused to help until 3rd call. No security at night! Lighting also poor, checking in at night, hard to find buildng/room numbers.

Reviews.Title: “Don't!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa S
Reviews.Content: We were originally very excited to find this hotel...until we arrived. Upon arrival, the parking lot was virtually empty, always a bad sign. Upon check in, we were told that the key machine was broken. Ok, things happen. We had to be let into our room by an employee. The room was nice but not equipped like your average Orlando time share. No dish soap, no frying pan or spatula (how are you supposed to cook eggs), not enough plates and glasses for the advertised sleeping quantity, outdated TV's, hard towels, rough sheets from K-mart (I saw them there), etc. But, Ok. We went out to dinner, returned later and still, no keys. We again had to be let in our own room. The next morning we were assured that the keys would be ready upon our return from the theme park. When we returned that afternoon (now day 2 of our stay), still no keys. The "manager" was very rude and said the keys would be ready "whenever they are ready". So, we again had to be let into our room. We waited for almost 30 minutes in the sun with kids having to use the bathroom before someone let us in. We were DONE! We checked out and went to another time share rental down the road and had a fantastic ending to our rocky start. By the way, ownership must have changed since all of Mike Ditka's stuff was there on day one, gone like the wind on day 2. Don't go here!

Reviews.Title: “5 STARS! BEAUTIFUL UNIT. CLEAN. FUN. SAFE.”
Reviews.Author: flynstyle
Reviews.Content: Booked this beautiful 3 bedroom unit + LOFT condo through Magical Memories Villas (google them and ask for Building 06- Unit 204)at Runaway Beach Club and it was incredible. The resort was gated, had an incredible pool and simply the best value. The unit had a 61" lcd tv in the game room, a beautiful kitchen, comfortable beds and more!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experiance.”
Reviews.Author: Melissa G
Reviews.Content: I was actually very surprised When I walked into the villa. It was higher than my expectations. The kitchen was very nice and the bathroom was spacious. Everything seemed to be in great condition. I was a little disappointed however that they didn't provide anything to hand wash dishes with(soap or sponge) We had to wash baby bottles and couldn't wait til the end of the night to run the dish washer. Another disappointing was the carpet. It looked fine however I have a crawler and she was black just after 10 mins of roaming around the villa. Also, the metal stripping on the ground between the rooms (i'm sure it has a name) was kind of coming up and I had to constantly watch my little one so she wouldn't get cut. Overall our experience was positive and we had a great time. My kids had a blast at the pool. We will be staying there again next time we head down to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Not Comfotable”
Reviews.Author: citizen111
Reviews.Content: This was a well situated resort not far from the attractions but it was not great place to stay. The sheets were all torn around the sides but useable. The carpet was unraveling at the doorways and dull. I had a few kids with me accompanied by an adult. They asked at the desk if the shuttle went to Universal and they said yes. Thje shuttle dropped them off at Epcot, Disney World. They only went to Epcot,( not Universal) and would not go back for them. After getting off and realizing where they were, they called us and had to wait until we got there to pick them up which took about 40 minutes, dressing and in traffic. They lost about 3 1/2 or 4 hours in the park, and it was a terrible scary situation waiting in the parking lot ( and scary for me). My daughter slept on the sofa bed and the blanket was stiffer than cardboard. They brought another but it was the same. The desk told me that all the extra blankets were like that. She slept with her coat. To top it off, we found 2 bugs in the bathroom. It looked really nice from the outside but inside was dreary and not up to par. There are far better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a relief”
Reviews.Author: sle516
Reviews.Content: We purchased a 3 night stay in a 2 bedroom suite from a local radio station auction for only $150. We were thrilled... until we read the Tripadvisor reviews. We were so nervous that I had picked several places in the area we could go to if our experience was as bad as some of the previous reviews.Luckily, we did not need to leave Mike Ditka's Runaway Beach club. We arrived around noon. Check in time is 4pm. To our surprise we we told our room was available. Art, who checked us in did say that "that does not happen too often". Art was very friendly and welcoming. Our package also included an autographed Mike Ditka football but Art could not find one. He said that they would deliver it to our room later that day. Still concerned about previous reviews we did not have great hopes that we would ever see the football but headed off to our room. Our room was actually a 3 bedroom, 2 bath town home. Our certificate was only for a 2 bedroom but they upgraded us. Since it was just my husband and myself we did not use the other bedrooms but we loved having a second bathroom. The living room, dining room and kitchen were all open to one another so it felt very spacious. It was decorated in a subtle nautical theme, not over the top. The living room had two full sized couches which looked like they were just cleaned. I believe they were both sofa sleepers. We had a flat screen TV and a DVD player The remote however did not have any batteries. The dining room had a taller pub height table that sat 4 plus there were two bar stools at the kitchen counter. The kitchen was well appointed with everything needed to cook for a whole family. There was 1 package of dish washing soap in the dishwasher. Since we were there for only 3 days and there were only 2 of us we only ran it the day we were leaving. But if we did need more supplies there was a Wal-Mart just around the corner. The master bedroom was on one side of the unit with the other two bedrooms down the hall to the other. This would be a great set up with a whole family. The master had a king sized pillow top mattress that was very comfortable and a tube TV that again had a remote with no batteries. There was a very large dresser that would have held more than a weeks worth of clothes if we were going to unpack. The master bathroom had a whirlpool tub and one sink with lots of counter space. Through the bathroom was a walk in closet that was very big. There were a few hangers but it would have been nice if they had a few more. Down the hall were the other two bedrooms with a full and twin bed in each. Since the unit slept 8-12 people we had plenty of towels for our 3 night stay but there was a full sized washer and dryer in the unit if we had needed to do laundry, We walked to the pool to spend the afternoon. The pool was large and clean and there was a nice kiddie pool as well. We sat out on the large deck overlooking the pond. The chair cushions here looked worn and thin. If they are going to invest any money in this hotel to silence the critics I would start here. When we returned to our room we were happily surprised to see our autographed football sitting in the foyer. This was the icing on the cake. The second night of our stay a family checked in above us. They were VERY loud. At first we chalked it up to them being excited to be in Orlando. But the next night we realized that there was a lack of insulation between the two rooms. They did not keep us up at night, but we did notice them. Overall, we had a wonderful stay at Mike Ditka's resort and would return again with the whole family next time.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Kristine G
Reviews.Content: Visited resort with living social deal . . .We did not get the type of room promised and even when they said they would credit us, it has been 3 weeks and no one will return my calls. If you decide to stay here ask for a second floor room, we stayed on first floor and had to listen to the peple up stairs all night . .I swear a thin peice of plywood was the only thing between the 2. The rooms were fairly clean but had a terrible musty smell. Staff is not accomodating, I could not get a towel after 6 because housekeeping left (this was after I had requested them in the morning and did not recieve them) Cheap is the best part of this deal . .but not worth it for us again.

Reviews.Title: “It's in the details”
Reviews.Author: sondrad
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at RBC for the last five years or so. It is always a pleasant stay. However I do have admonish them for missing some of the details that makes a resort five star, which I fully believe they have the capacity to be! Starting with checkin. The front desk is often unmanned. No one to greet you does not feel welcoming. Top resorts never leave the front desk unattended. The front desk staff are not surly but neither are they overly welcoming. You are left with the impression that they are just doing their job, which they do well. But some personality and joy would start our experience here on the best foot. Secondly, the list of things that you will be charged for, along with the amount of each, has to go! How unwelcoming to read through the packet of info and see this first thing! Disney does not do this- it's distancing and makes me feel accused before I even enjoy myself. Outside the buildings, at the entry doer, are cans of sand filled with cig butts. They smell, a whiff of which you ey eveyte to enter or exit your unit. I get why they are there, but they should be emptied daily. Plantings around the buildings could greatly enhance their curb appeal. Again, they are nice enough but lack the detail - such as lush platings - that would make a stand out five star resort. Painting inside the units is needed, at least on the one we stayed in. Gouges in the wall and worn paint makes it feel tired. They ate truly beautiful units, spacious, very clean, bright. But those small details your eye notices makes and impression. Also, replace any worn linens- our bed blanket had three cigarette burn holes in it. Unappealing. Overall we really enjoy the report which is why we have returned year over year. I just know thy if they pay Trenton and address the details, Prague the beat in everything, they really can be a five star resort!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Family V
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed with the entire stay. It was an awful experience. Let be begin by stating that I am almost 8 months pregnant and was traveling with my husband, 2 year old child, in-laws and my parents. This is why we booked a 3 bedroom 3 bath unit way in advance on January 21. The day before we arrived I called the 800 at your resort to see if we may have an early check in - this way we may store our bags in the room and get accommodated and then head to the parks [we were celebrating my 2 year old's birthday]. I was told that it would not be possible because you were fully booked and the earliest we can probably check to see was between 2 and 3 PM. That was not going to work for us so instead of checking in we went straight to the parks since we had no where else to go at 11 AM. Needless to say after driving almost 5 hours to get to Kissimee and spending an entire day at the Disney park, we arrived at nearly midnight to the check-in area. At this time we were told that all that was available was a 2 bedroom 2 bath suite. This is absolutely the most unprofessional and inconsiderate thing that has been done to me. After we clearly booked the 3/3 suite in January we were downgraded to a 2/2 without prior notification to us at all! No one authorized this nor did we ever requested a 2/2 suite. My confirmation was for a 3/3 suite. We were told that night by the gentleman in the front check in desk that someone at Mike Ditka had made the change the day before. WHAT?! I could not even believe this! I am so disgusted by this it's not even funny! How can someone at the resort just make a change to MY reservation just like that after I clearly booked a 3/3? This was an extreme inconvenience and very uncomfortable stay for us. We had no where else to go at that time at night. Some very inconsiderate and unprofessional person at the resort decided it was best for them to give our suite to another party. Who the hell do they think they are!!!??? Till today just reliving the entire experience pisses me off all over again! I have stayed in MANY hotels throughout my life and this has never been done to me. The lack of regard for me and my family is just uncalled for and unacceptable! Also, we were being charged just $20 less than what we would have paid for the 3/3. I believe this to be a ridiculously high price given the inconvenience and aggravation the resort made us go through. The least that could have been done for us is to give us a free night. To top it all off, the 2/2 suite we received was dirty. The carpet was filthy, the kitchen floor had grease on it and slippery [luckily I did not fall]. There was hair on the supposedly clean towels (which did not smell clean at all), the pull out sofa-bed was broken, the DVD player did work and...well why bother to go on. Like I said it was just awful.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious,pleasant surroundings, and good location make a good weekend”
Reviews.Author: Saras0tagirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and were pleasantly surprised by the resort and our one bedroom villa. Some of the previous reviews were less than complementary,but we found our stay quiet pleasant. The villa was quiet spacious. It was clean with nice furnishings and plenty of towels for our use. The rooms did smell of Chlorox, but some febreeze, the fans, and opening the door for a while took care of the smell. The front desk personnel were very professional and pleasant. They explained what our stay included and answered our questions. We would definitely stay here again on our next visit to the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Stay - Nov 2011”
Reviews.Author: BLaMay
Reviews.Content: Great property, close to Disney, Epcot, Downtown Disney, restaurants. My wife, 4 year old daugher, and I stayed 2 nights Nov 7-9, 2011 in a one bedroom suite. Suite as basically a 1 bedroom townhouse with full kitchen and living room. The two sofas in the lviing room pulled out into beds which my four year old loved since she got to watch tv in bed before going to sleep for the night. Entry was on the ground floor and stairs led up to the suite on the 2nd floor. The room is stocked with basics - toilet paper, soap, coffee, dishwashing soap for the diswasher. You have to pay extra if you use up what's stocked, but there was more than enough for our 2 night stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. It was too cold to use the pool, but it looked nice. The property was well kept and we had no problems or issues like some of the other posts mention. Upon checkout, we witnessed a guest compliaining about a stain in the room he had just checked into and the staff was more than apologetic and provided him another room immediately. We plan on staying here again on our next Disney vacation next year. I would highly recommend it for anyone who is stayinf for more than a one or two nights and/or is looking for an townhouse type room.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: jpechar
Reviews.Content: I prepaid for an overnight stay at this resort as I had a large party for a trip to disney the following day. When we checked in, check in wasn't until 3pm, we were told a daily use charge would be added to my bill and the shuttle to Disney had ended for the day. we were going to the Christmas parade and conveyed this to the staff when making my reservation. Most of the staff I dealt with was either new or disinterested in my party's needs. I am a avid traveler and would never stay here again.The room was very nicely appointed and clean with the exception of the coffee maker which still had the prior guests coffee still in it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and location”
Reviews.Author: Flexecutives
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Mike Ditka Resorts before and after a Disney Cruise, and during a 4 day visit to Disney World; 3 adults and 2 children had 2 different 3 bedroom suites. It is great location, just outside the gates of Disney World, and a short walking distance from a very large Wal-Mart department and grocery store. It is also close to other shopping and chain location dining. The suite was very spacious and well equipped for multiple generation family groups (4 televisions), with a good kitchen and dining area. Location was gated and very quiet despite its proximity to major highways. As a low rise development, parking is just outside your suite, facilitating delivery of luggage, groceries etc. We would stay there again, and recommend it to others. The pool area and gymnasium are good for children. Price was excellent. Only issues: Check-in wasn't available until 4 p.m., and the reception staff was quite inflexible on this point (We arrrived at 12). You would think that since their check out time was 11 a.m., they could surely clean a suite in less than 5 hours, since the resort ws not busy when we arrived??????. We had been travelling since before 5 a.m. with young children. The suites are clean but a little tired, and could use a freshening up.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: kynatv
Reviews.Content: The Mike Ditka Resort 2 bedroom condo was a nice retreat. The 2 bedr condo rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. Pool area nice and well kept as well as the grounds. A very nice place to relax after any activities. Thanks! .MDJM

Reviews.Title: “Good value for what we paid”
Reviews.Author: 421KWM50
Reviews.Content: We had purchased a Living Social voucher and stayed 2 nights. Our unit was clean, comfortable and roomy. I only wish I would have known to bring extra soap and shampoo. I would not have minded bringing my own but this was the first time I actually counted on amenties to be provide but a short walk to a WalMart solved the problem. Pools were clean and warm; hot tub was great. The whole area was quiet and well lit.Front desk staff was friendly and helpful for our needs. We were here in off season----beginning of February. .If another Living Social voucher was offered we would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own..... EVERYTHING!!!”
Reviews.Author: KelseyL
Reviews.Content: I would not stay at this resort EVER again, even if someone PAID me to. I literally can NOT believe this place. And to have Mike Ditka's name on this resort - disgrace. The service to this resort is literally GRADE F. We went trying to check in a little early because we had a day planned to go to Disney.. Although after traveling 8 hours with luggage and a stroller in the trunk with two kids, we needed some where to put our luggage to get the stroller out. First the lady at the front desk said she was going to see what she could do and another lady came over and started whispering to her... Then the lady looked up and said nope. No rooms. There all dirty. So we decided that we were just going to go ahead and go to Disney and worry about checking in later. My son then had to use the restroom and I overheard her on the phone telling somebody they could check in now but they had to pay for half a day. I then approached her and said so if I pay for a half day can we set our luggage in our room - she rolled her eyes at me and said "What part of all the rooms are dirty did you not understand?" I was like well okay then.. We went on about our day and returned at 8 O clock to check in. The resort looks beautiful from the outside... but once you get on the inside - its a different story. I think that this place COULD be ran nice, but they refuse to take the time and effort to do so. They want to run it cheaply apparently. . Here's a list of problems that were NOT satisfactory: -Had to go buy towels and wash clothes because all 20 towels in the room were stained and had hair all over them. -requested a pack and play upon reservation, was not able to have one until the 2nd night and was told I should have requested one sooner. How can I request a pack and play BEFORE my reservation? - Attitude of the staff is HORRIBLE - Carpet was filthy - looked like it hadn't been vacuumed in weeks - huge hole in the roof where it appeared to be they had a leak and looked like the DUCT tapped it and painted over it. -dirty and scum in bath tub - door stoppers were old and rusted -beds were old and spring (most uncomfortable bed I EVER slept on) -Furniture in living room looked like a dog had attacked and chewed up everything. - got a "welcome letter" upon check in explaining the starter kit.. basically saying - they provide one roll of toilet paper, 1 small bottle of shampoo and a bar of soap and not to ask for anything else because anything else you need to provide yourself. -housekeeping doesn't come daily. if you want them to clean, depending on your resort size - it can range anywhere from $20 - $60 a day.. -TV in the master bedroom didn't work -the tvs were like 19' inch samsung "flat screens' - cob webbs in the ceiling - fan COVERED with dust - master bedroom bathroom fan ROARED every time you turned it on - no curtains on the windows - so the lights from outside peak thru at night -my son fell down the stairs backwards because the dining room table was so close to the stairs - minor repairs made throughout the resort were done without effort -dirty smudges throughout the resort on the walls and closet doors -mildew in the refrigerator like I said, I wouldn't stay here if someone paid me. When these issues were addressed upon checkout the front desk clerk had no remorse and didn't apologize what so ever. We told her we would never stay there again and she responded "I have heard that before and smirked." We stayed at Homewood Suites by Hilton Buenva Vista for 2 nights before we went to this resort, wish we would have stayed there longer! That hotel was BEYOND exceptional. Do your self a favor and run FAR away from this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and horrible service!!!”
Reviews.Author: AP2168
Reviews.Content: I bought a Living Social 2-night stay for this resort. I went on a Saturday late afternoon with my 2 kids hoping to have a nice weekend in Disney. I checked in, not the friendliest staff, went to our room. As I opened the door, first thing I saw was 2 HUGE stains on the carpet, and a horrendous smell of Clorox bleach, which slightly overpowered the smell of mold and mildew. My daughter and I are highly allergic to all the things. I called the front desk to let them know that we couldn't breathe in that villa, she said the entire resort was booked, and she would said someone from housekeeping over with some air fresheners. Well, housekeeping just walked in without knocking, started spraying Febreeze all over the place, which only made it worse. I opened the unscreened windows for a while, didn't help. There was no way we could sleep there, so we went to check back out, and find another place to stay. They wouldn't refund me the $200.00 because I did it through Living Social; the manager refused to come out of her office to talk to me. I went to the Calypso Cay resort right next door, which I highly recommend, paid $375.00, but had the BEST service. I sent an email to corporate office of the Mike Ditka resort, didn't respond right away, then sent me the nastiest letter, telling me that he won't do anything for me and to never come back. This is why the Mike Ditka resort is going under; poorly maintained, and the absolute WORSTE customer service I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “I would probably never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: HonestReviewer27
Reviews.Content: The room is big and has a full kitchen which is helpful but that's all thats good about it. The beds were old and springy and one even sunk in from one side. The sofa bed was so springy, I left with back pain as I was the one staying there. The carpet is old and dirty, the bathroom counters are pealing and they don't care to change it, it looks ugly. To top it off customer services is mediocre, the girl at front desk never smiled was straight to the point. Just so you know they don't provide housekeeping services so as long as your stay is, they will never come and do the bed, change towels nor clean. They only give you a limited amount of towels and if you want more you will need to pay and those room towels are supposed to be for pool too as they don't provide pool towels. If you are planning on going to the pool BRING YOUR OWN TOWEL. We stayed there because I got a deal with Groupon and the price was right for our budget but wouldn't look to stay there again. Also if you need shuttle make sure you get a voucher before you leave cause otherwise turns into a big mission. If you can find something around the same price else where with better reviews stay a that other place. If clean place and comfortable beds is whats important to you, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious condo close to Disney World!”
Reviews.Author: Misscole33
Reviews.Content: This was a nice large place and the price was great as we used a groupon. Pros: Shuttle to Disney World Nice pool and hot tub Large rooms with full kitchen with dishwasher, stove and granite counter. Cons: Carpet, blinds and bed were warn Customer service was mediocre. Tips: be sure to get a boarding pass for the Disney shuttle as we were never told to Bring coffee, laundry and dish detergent, and beach towels if you can fit them in. The other reviews helped so were prepared with these extras.

Reviews.Title: “Needs upgrade”
Reviews.Author: honest_reviewFlorida
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there multiple times over the past 3 yrs. it appears that they do not perform any upgrades to their rooms. 3 years ago the mattress was ok. My last stay 1 week ago, as soon as i get in the bed, the mattress would squeak and sink about 5 in. Where the springs are pooking your back. The bed cover is so old and smells. Stains on the sheets. BAsically, they are letting the place go down the drain. I used to feel as if it was 4.5 stars, now it's barely 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Our experience really was terrible...”
Reviews.Author: Tierney M
Reviews.Content: I would give this "resort" a rating of zero if I could, our stay at the Runaway Beach Club was nothing short of terrible. Upon arrival to our second floor 2 bedroom suite, it was clear that the toilets (SO GROSS) had not been cleaned, there were food particles on the side and under one of the beds, dirty (mucus stained) sheets. Please, please please do not stay at this resort... we were looking for affordable accommodations near Disney, swiped up a livingsocial deal, and I have to say it was not worth the money at all. Upon checkout we expressed our unsatisfactory experience, and were told that we called housekeeping the day of check in and said that we would clean the toilets ourselves (UH NO WAY!!). And there was nothing could do about the rates. The customer service went downhill from there. Rooms dirty, pools cold, oh the cabana is not open every day (we were told their bartender quit)... so the $30 resort credit we got with livingsocial had to be used buying soda in the gift shop :(. AS I SAID BEFORE, PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE, there is truly nothing redeeming about this resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for--but no more”
Reviews.Author: shuarjefe
Reviews.Content: The good news. The one bedroom is spacious with a pullout couch accommodating four. It is a great location: close to Disney and convenient to other parks. There a lot of deals to bring the price down. The rest. Room rates. Beware of resort and amenity fees. The only amenities are a pool (nice), a small fitness room, and an indoor half basketball court. There are a bunch of other fees that can run up the tab--a lot! Our suite wreaked of chlorine bleach when checked in. It lingered for three days. Living room furniture was soiled and the upholstery was torn. The springs at one end of the couch were broken. The bed was very spongy and the coverlet was very old. Housekeeping comes once every four days. BTW bring your own soap, shampoo, towels for the pool. There is no restaurant. There is a small shop with expensiveitmes for sale. We did get a $15 creditto use when we checked in. Bottom line--we will stay elsewhere next time. There are better options.

Reviews.Title: “Mike Ditka Resorts is the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: jan233
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times and it has always been great. Clean, quite and a home away from home. Already planning our next trip here! "." MDJM

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value and all round fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Aneisha
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 10 day stay at the Mike Ditka resort. We found the resort to be ideal for our family and had a great time there. The facility itself offers everything described e.g two swimming pools (one adult one child), gym, hot tub etc. You will receive a small supply of coffee, sugar and toilet paper on arrival that should last for a number of days but you will need to replenish these within days. You also get enough drinking glasses and cutlery, a few towels, one saucepan, frying pan, a couple of trays but only one kitchen towel. All these items can be hired but at nearly $5 are far too expensive in my opinion so depending on the numbers in your party you may need to take extra towels and I would also bring an additional kitchen towel. There is also housekeeping offered but again was too expensive besides the property has washing machine, tumble dryer and dishwasher. The staff were very pleasant and helpful and helped us whenever we needed anything. There is a free shuttle to Disney parks and Lake Buena Vista shopping outlet where you will find some shops offering very good discounts including tickets for Disney parks and universal studios so definitely worth visiting I wish we had done earlier. The resort uses a taxi company which turned out to be slightly cheaper than taking one from the airport otherwise we used Mears cars on 407 – 839 1570 which we found reasonable and very reliable. Please note that a lot of taxis charge per person including for children over a certain age – our daughter was 14 and paid adult fare for everything. There are a number of shops within 10 minutes walking distance of Mike Ditka and the shortest route is to come out of the resort, turn left and across over the Country In Suite car park where you will find a large Wal-Mart amongst other smaller shops. The resort itself is not well known by people around Kissimmee so you will have to ask for Calypso Cay or Country Inn Suite which is the hotel directly opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs some upgrades”
Reviews.Author: roy p
Reviews.Content: For the value it was nice BUT they really need some upgrades. The bathtub was in a bad shape, I don't know who designed the shower but if your over 4'5" tall you will have to duck. the couch had what looked like a cigarette burn hole in it plus is was way outdated. both remote controls needed batteries, the inside of the cabinets needed some serious cleaning. the dryer hose on the back was not connected so that whole room was covered in lint. we had to use the heat one night and i noticed the filter looked as if it were never changed. The pool areas was nice, good for kids with zero entry, the outside areas are nice. Staff was good, no real complaints other than it needs a serious upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Never been treated so poorly”
Reviews.Author: tsarahrn
Reviews.Content: I recently made reservations online for this resort. When I arrived with my husband, 2 very excited young kids, and a packed car, I was told my reservation was not in their system. I showed them my confirmation and they said there was nothing they could do. They said they were at full capacity, however, if they had found our reservation they would have to find us a room. When I reminded them how impossible it was to find a room in Orlando during a holiday week, they sat stone-faced and shrugged their shoulders. I have never been treated so poorly in my life. My 3-yr-old daughter was crying, and we drove around in circles in Orlando trying to find a place to stay. I will never be returning to this resort, EVER!!!

Reviews.Title: ““Paradise Lost... through mismanagement””
Reviews.Author: Tradu C
Reviews.Content: Really Bad Experiences with this Hotel. The picture is amazing, but all of the other horrible aspects. The rooms are unkempt, drab, smelly, and generally run-down. The management is rude and uncooperative. And the cost? It is too expensive for the quality. Be carefull. Just don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: krickettlove
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our cruise to go to Disney and Universal. So since we had just been on a cruise this place wasn't the same. We had 4 adults and a lot (I mean a lot of luggage). We found our villa and opened the door to see stairs...we had been driving half a day and at Universal the rest of the day, we were pretty tired and not prepared to carry our massive amount of luggage up stairs. But it was our own fault for checking in after hours. Once we got everything up stairs it seemed pretty nice. There were just a few things that needed attention...the carpet needs to be replaced, it was worn out in a few places and it could have used a quick spot cleaning. The bathrooms were nice. The kitchen was beautiful! The livingroom nice and cozy. The bedrooms were spacious, but the beds were horrendous. Very uncomfortable and squeaky. The location was perfect...right around the corner from Disney and a block from a WalMart. If the beds were updated and more comfortable it would be an ideal place to stay. We would consider it again.

Reviews.Title: “Disneyworld Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: lovethebeach155019
Reviews.Content: I don't like to complain, but.... when we arrived there was no one at the front desk. They were all int he back eating pizza, and the employee that came out to serve us was chewing her food and wiping her greasy hands on her pants. Not very professional. The room was large and fairly clean. There was a light bulb burnt out in the master closet (shouldn't they check these things?), and the T.V in the master bedroom did not work half of the time. We did call about the tv, someone came, but wasn't successful. No offer of changing it. One night upon our return from the parks we came home to a flood. A massive flood in the kitchen and bedroom. We called the fron deske who informed us that there was no room to change us to, but he would make a note and let maintenance know. This was the day that housekeeping was scheduled to come, but didn't. Another night - two days later we came home to yet another flood. Much worse this time. Had saturated the second bedroom and all of my childrne's clothes. This was the night before we were leaving and I called the front desk in the morning to ask for a late check out becuase of this. I was told I could not as they were fully booked. I told the sales manager that they would have trouble putting anyon ein that room in the condition it was. Still no late checkout. When I went to the front desk to check out, I spoke with the sales manager who told me that there was no report on file for when I had called in earlier to report the first flood. I did not receive an apology, or a reduction on my stay for the immense inconvience etc... The rooms are large and spacious for a family to stretch out, and you are very close to Disney. The pool is nice, but cold. Lots of lounge chairs. Kids loved the virgin pina coladas. Housekeeping was great. I found the staff to be on the lower end of customer service with a lot of apathy. The customer service made the whole resort feel like a low end budget resort. Even low end budget resorts can have excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “We'd come back”
Reviews.Author: Dean W
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic for Disney and other major attractions. Even a free shuttle. The resort is attractive and well maintained. We had a 2 bed unit which was very spacious. Only a few minor maintenance things like a blown bulb etc. which is no issue. The servicing of the units between tennants is poor. The cleaners obviously only do a cursory lipservice clean, so wash your kitchen items and benches etc. before use. Overall we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “You just keep coming back.”
Reviews.Author: Jrey918
Reviews.Content: We love Mike Ditka's runway beach resort. As a matter of fact we told our friends of our experiences at Ditka's and said the same thing. Great place to relax and have fun. Location is very convenient. All of what was said at a very reasonable price. You actually get and enjoy more of what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Hazardous!”
Reviews.Author: Mary W
Reviews.Content: So when we arrived we were pleased to find out they upgraded us to a 3-bedroom suite. Wish they hadn't! Several item were broken and found a cockroach in the living room where our babies were playing. Then, the fan in the babies room broke with blades flying off and hitting the walls all WHILE they were sleeping in the room. Maintenance was very speedy but no call from management for an apology and they wouldn't even come talk to me when I went to the front desk. We checked out a day early and still got the run around...insinuating we actually did something to the fan. TERRIBLE service!

Reviews.Title: “Great place horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Rhondaroo3683
Reviews.Content: The room was great, getting there was a little but confusing for us but it was very nice, spacy. We got the two room suite and was very pleased. The ONLY downfall was the service. ALL of the girls that worked there were rude, not helpful, and didnt seem interested in workin at all. I did not see one smile from any of the workers and they were just very horrible. I will stay there again because of the price and location but you could stay across the street and at least get friendly service for a steeper price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor and "Runaway"...”
Reviews.Author: LS1971
Reviews.Content: We were staying in the Orlando area for two nights, and saw a promotional rate for Mike Ditka Resorts Runaway Beach Club through livingsocial.com and figured we give it a try. When we arrived for our two night stay, we went in to our unit and were pleased by the fresh bleach scent. The unit appeared to be as shown on the web site (2 Bedroom Luxury Villa) and in good shape. For the money, there really wasn't a lot to complain about. A king size bed was in the master, two beds in the second room and a pull out sofa bed. We unpacked after our long trip and noticed in the second bedroom there was a blade missing from the ceiling fan and the master bedroom had no chain to shut the fan off. Well, not the end of the world, but come on. Well, we were tired and just wanted to relax. We turned the kitchen sink on to wash a few cups and unfortunately the sink faucet was leddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddaking pretty bad and flooded the counter. We called the front desk and within minutes had a maintenance person there to assist us. He couldn't repair it with us there so they moved us to a different unit. We arrived at the new unit and this time instead of a fresh clean scent, we were hit by the stench of cigarettes. Despite the smell, the place looked pretty clean, we were tired and so we stayed. So, now we get ready for bed, pull down the very worn duvets and notice some serious issues. The twin bed's box spring was absolute falling apart. Literally, the stitching was completely undone, the foam and cloth cover was off and under it was cardboard stapled to what was left of the box frame. We turned to the double bed and the box spring cover was intact, but the box spring itself was broken and bent, offering no support to the lower portion of the bed. The pullout bed was missing several springs and my 5 year old daughter actually fell through when she sat down on it. She ended up getting sandwiched in half between the frame and mattress support. For small children this is a serious injury waiting to happen. We called the front desk and asked for the manager to come to out unit to see the overall condition. We were of course told the cleaning crews noted no issues with the unit and she seemed to imply we must have done something. I quickly put an end to that implication, but she still refused to come to the unit. I was told a maintenance person be over to look at it. The guy arrived and said he'd have to go see if there were any more beds, which was a stall tactic. As we later found out, these units are individually owned timeshare/condo type units which are managed by Geneva Hospitality and marketed under Ditka's name under license. Any purchases would have to be approved by the unit's owner which wouldn't happen for days or weeks. A short while later we called the front desk again and were told it was too late in the day for them to do anything and there were no other units available for them to move us in to. I told them they needed to give us some credit or completely comp the stay because this was rediculous. I was told I had to speak with Katie Rondon the Customer Relations person in the morning and that she was the only person who could do anything. At this point we had no choice but to deal with it. I figured I'd try to make the best of it, so decided to spin the box spring on the double bed so at least the broken portion would have some support. I lifted the mattress and to my disgust there was a used comdom laying there on the box spring. YES, A USED COMDOM!!! In 16 years of business travel including several 3rd world countries, I've never been presented with such appalling sleeping conditions. This was absolutely inexcusable. Morning came, I called the front desk and of course Katie Rondon was "unavailable". I called back again and after a pause was told she was "on a conference call" and I would get a call back. 45 minutes later, still no call back, so we decided to go pay her a visit. Katie wasn't on the phone and was sitting at a desk in the office just to the left of the front desk, so it was hard for them to make any excuses. I explained the room conditions and asked her to go see it with us. She of course refused and said there's nothing she could do to credit us or comp the stay. Since she wouldn't go to the room, I showed her photos and told her of the used condom under the mattress. Amazingly she didn't seem to be in the least bit phased by it. I can only assume it's a common occurrance. Her only comment was she'd go to the room later and take her own photos, send them to her management and we should hear from her by Friday at the latest (it was Tuesday). That's it! No apology, no empathy, no nothing. NOTHING!!!!! Friday of course came and went and we never did hear from Katie Rondon or anyone else from Mike Ditka Resorts Runaway Beach Club, or Geneva Hospitality. SO....IF your expectations are low and you have no reasonable expectation of service should ANYTHING go wrong, you've got yourself a great place to stay. But if you have any reasonable expectation of quality and service, do yourself a favor and as the name suggests, "RUNAWAY" from this place. With so many other options in the Orlando/Kissimmee area it's simply not worth the risk or hassle. Some other notable items: The kitchen's ceiling was peeling and damaged due to a water leak from the unit above. "top of the line appliances" - Were not so top of the line, especially the 700watt efficiency apartment sized microwave so small you could barely get a bag of popcorn in it. "32” flat view televisions" - Don't get these confused with modern flat panel HDTV displays, these are the 1980's Sony flat screen tube televisions. "Gourmet Coffee Maker & Starbucks® Brand Coffee" - This was a $17 Mr. Coffee Coffee maker and 1 bag of S&D Hotel Coffee (NOT STARBUCKS).

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Pool Cold, Service Average”
Reviews.Author: SouthFloridaFamily
Reviews.Content: Nice big clean rooms. Make sure and bring your own supplies. Pool is average and must not be heated. Tiki Bar very limited items.

Reviews.Title: “wd1111”
Reviews.Author: kurt k
Reviews.Content: I took my wife and 4 children on vacation to Orlando.The resort is in an excellent location and the 3-room suite was very spacious. The price to stay here is significantly less than if we had to stay in 2 hotel rooms. The cleanliness is average. Overall, it is a great deal for large families. Unfortunately, because of the good value, the resort attracts many undesirable people. We were unable to ever get a good nights sleep because our neighbors were up partying to 4am every night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Mike Ditkas”
Reviews.Author: lizzie63Mississauga
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Mike Ditkas Runaway Beach Club in Kissimmee recently. We bought a one night stay in a one bedroom Villa thru Groupon. We did not know what to expect and were pleasantly surprised upon arrival. The front desk staff were very friendly and the grounds were nicely kept. We had a one bedroom villa with partial kitchen, washer, dryer, large bedroom, ensuite bath and shower, large livingroom. The only drawback is there are many stairs to go up to the second floor where everything is located. Our unit was very clean and well stocked with everything we would need for a one week stay but we were there for one night. On the property were two large heated pools and a hot tub that was very hot. We would recommend this resort for a one night or one week stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect trip!!”
Reviews.Author: Cpark321
Reviews.Content: I came to go to Epcot with a couple of my friends and we had an amazing time. The room was very nice and clean, and it was in a great location. Having the shuttle that took us directly to the park made our day! We will definitely be returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sharkbait05
Reviews.Content: Pros: This resort is really close to the Disney World parks, and offers a free shuttle service to and from the parks. They offer 24 hour check-in, which is great for late arrivals. They also have a really nice work-out facility, pool, and mini basketball court. The place was decent for the price spent. The staff is friendly and answered the phone almost immediately when called. Cons: The bed had crumbs in it when we got there. There were dirty towels, or well, badly stained towels. A huge roach was in the floor when we arrived as well. The website boast "Starbucks" brand coffee, but it was some cheap hotel grade coffee when we arrived. And was told that the only coffee we would receive was what was in there. I was not expecting to only get 1 decaf and 1 regular coffee pack to last for 5 days. I would stay again, as it is a very convenient location. I just hope that things are actually updated on their website to give a more accurate description of what they offer. MDJZ

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Stephen B
Reviews.Content: We had a bachelor party and upon arrival found many long hairs in the showers, pulled the towels out and found that many of them had crusty yellow stains all over them. the beds and pillows appeared to have the same issues as well as the sofas as well. the place was disgusting. By far the worst hotel i have ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed before but this time I was not satisfied @ all!”
Reviews.Author: Tt0124
Reviews.Content: When called for new towels was told they don't give them out. That's what the washer and dryer and on the rooms for.. Rude! Ceiling had brown mold spots. Wall in front of washer had mold spots. Towels were dirty Knob on bathroom sink was broken. So you couldn't tell if you were using hot or cold water. Carpet was torn in some places. Rooms dusty. I hope the resort can get it together! Until it does so I will not be going back anytime soon : /

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay ! !”
Reviews.Author: rafg8496
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a one bedroom this weekend. It was Large, Clean and Welcoming. My family and I truly enjoyed it. The staff was great. Thank you for making our trip so pleasant. Now we have a great place to stay when in town. Also Thumbs Up For The Rates ! ! Awesome

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Great Service!!”
Reviews.Author: Kristine H
Reviews.Content: We recently came back from a weekend stay here and would highly recommend this resort. We booked a one bedroom through Expedia. Booking was easy and the room was under $80 a night even with the resort fee (which was eleven bucks a night I believe with tax). There were three adults and two kids in our group. The resort was easy to locate off of 192 in Kissimmee and nearby everything, all the Orlando parks are minutes away. Check in was quick and efficient. Half of our party was Universal Studios for the Halloween Horror event, and my husband and I were still out to dinner at 9 pm when my sister showed up with two exhausted teenagers in tow. She was given a key and a parking pass and was in the room when we showed back up, no problems, and was very impressed with the front desk staff. The one bedroom "condo hotel" room had a king bed in the room and two full size sofa beds in the spacious living room. It had a very nice kitchen with all appliances in good working order including the very necessary coffee maker and microwave. It had a small dining table and a tv in the bedroom and living room. The rooms were in very good shape, seemed freshly painted, clean, and the place was well furnished with plenty of closet space, etc . The one bathroom was very large, clean, and had plenty of counterspace. My suggestions for those who stay here is to remember that if you decide to book the room without paying extra for housekeeping, etc that you bring some commonhousehold supplies or pick them up at the local wal-mart across the street when you get there. The room comes with a set of clean towels and the bed and sofa beds made up with clean linen,and a starter kit of basics (little shampoo, kleenex, toilet paper etc).The kitchen has some basic dishes and a teapot, but no pots and pans. We knew this before we left. We brought paper towels, toilet paper, paper plates and cups, some utensils, etc for our short stay. They have a dishwasher and washer dryer but no soap so you will need to get that too for longer stays . The dryer was a godsend for wet towels from the pool. We bought along some extra towels too for the pool.Once again, you can find all of this cheap and local if you are flying in. We had to call the front desk for an extra blanket it arrived in minutes. We also had to request a plunger for the toilet ( not hotels problem, see the word "teenager"above and roll eyes appropriately they think everything can be flushed) and that showed up quickly too. The resort itself was well laid out and the pool area was beautiful and well maintained. I highly recommend the hot and bubbling jacuzzi after a day walking the parks. I would say the only negative we can point to is that all the single rooms were on the upper stories of the units ( which all look like cute little beachhouses) and there is a VERY steep set of stairs which is a good workout at the best of times and reason to cry a little after a day walking around everywhere LOL.But that was a minor thing and not unworkable for the value these rooms represent in this area. If you had elderly folks in your party I would spring some extra for one of the lower two bedrooms ( or the one with the lofts and make the kids use the stairs). You can also pay extra for several levels of houskeeping. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Large room, good deal, but quirks”
Reviews.Author: D T
Reviews.Content: Our room was great for a large family or group. Could prob sleep 8+ with 2 BR and 2 sofas, 2 spacious baths, kitchen,dining area, and living room. Lots of towels, wash cloths. Pool area very pretty. Two pools with fountains plus hot tub. However, we had to wait 20 min to check in. The bathrooms offered USED bottles of lotion and shampoo (noticed in the morning and too late to complain). They give you a list of how many soaps, sugars, creamers, coffees, etc that are a "starter pack" for your room. After that you pay for extra. They must get huge groups in each room who ransack this stuff. Just seemed cheap to me. Tiki bar was not open the day we arrived and we had a credit for Tiki bar or gift shop. Gift shop was a joke....candy bars, water, a few overpriced Ditka Resort shirts, tee shirts, plastic bottles,or sweat shirts. Our room was very quiet and away from pool.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ebony B
Reviews.Content: For the past two years when I came to the Kissimmee area I have stayed at the Mike Ditka resort. The first year I stayed with my family after a business trip and the kids loved it! The second year when I came up for a business conference I choose to stay here instead of the hotel where my conference was located. Now I'm planning a separate trip to the area and I will be staying here and also when I plan my business trip as well. MAR.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect...for our family”
Reviews.Author: keithsam
Reviews.Content: I found the resort to be perfectly adequate! I took my family of five to Orlando and we scored a one bedroom villa for $65 p/ngt. Before booking I was some what hesitant but my wife talked me into it (glad I listened to her this time). Check in was pleasant and fast. The villa was spacious, clean and had a full kitchen, TV with DVD player, two couches that convert into full size beds (which I found to be surprisingly comfortable) It was basically a large aparment. We parked right next to our front door. The resort has a decent pool, workout room, and a half court indoor basketball gym. There is that pesky $11 p/day resort fee which includes use of their Wifi and shuttle to and from Disneyworld. Now the bad (but not really), this resort isn’t full service, it’s more of an efficiency ‘a la carte’ type of place. No housekeeping is included if you are staying less than seven nights. There are no pool towels, you must use the same towels from your unit. However there is an in unit washer and dryer. I do concur with some other reviewers in that they could spend a couple of bucks to make some minor repairs to the place but those things were so minor that after a couple of hours you forget them, it's kind of like being at home, lol! There’s a big strip mall just across the street that included a Super Wal-Mart which is open 24 hrs, a Gas station, places to buy tickets to all the attractions (Disney, Universal, Sea World, etc.) and a number of other places to eat and buy stuff. So all in all if you are on a budget as we were (and always are) you get more bang for your buck, however if you require a full service facility then maybe you should stay closer in to Disneyworld or in Orlando where you will most certainly pay upwards of $200-300 p/ngt.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Around - Still A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: pghfamily489
Reviews.Content: Since we experienced a great vacation last June, 2010, our family decided to try Mike Ditka's Runaway Beach Club Resort in Kissimmee, FL again. Our 6 members thoroughly enjoyed the close proximity to area parks and restaurants, and the security of a gated resort. We were able to take advantage of outstanding room rates for our 16 day stay. The only negative matter was a problem with the electronic door key reader that was fixed promptly by the resort's staff. My thanks to the staff at Ditka's for another fine vacation. See you again, soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of service ruins potential.”
Reviews.Author: DeGags2
Reviews.Content: Terrible service. From the moment we checked in we encountered lackluster hospitality. We were told there was 24hr check in. However, upon our arrivalwe were immediately greeted with "check-in isn't until 4." Which was followed by informing me that I could check-in four hours early but there would be a $40 charge. She presented the charge as if it were a penalty rather than a convenience fee. She then proceeded to convey a littany of services the resort does NOT offer. I felt like I was back in Catholic high school. Not once did the girl smile, welcome or thank me. The rooms are spacious and a real value, but some knobs were missing, some amenities were missing, and there was no soccer ball for the foosball table.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Mike Ditka Resorts”
Reviews.Author: tbear0415
Reviews.Content: My family & I enjoyed our stay at Mike Ditka Resorts in Orlando Florida. The resort is in the perfect location to enjou Disney, Universal & Sea World, all within 1/2 hour of less from the resort, and only 1/2 hour away from Orlando International Airport. I really liked that I was able to cook my meals as I have dietary issues that makes it difficult for me to eat out. The bedrooms & bathrooms were great as well as the living area. While no one likes to do laundry on a vacation, I found it to be a plus to not have to do any laundry on my return home (and make it possible to pack less clothes!) I would recommend Mike Ditkas to anyone going to Florida. In fact, that is how I learned about this great resort. I would definetely stay there again!! "." MDCC

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Great, just decent”
Reviews.Author: HSciar
Reviews.Content: For the price, we wouldn't stay here again. There are better resorts to stay at for $170 (room & fees) per night. FIrst you cannot check in until 4 PM, not 3, not even 3:55. The reason? "the room isn't ready yet" The condo unit we were assigned too was very nice on first appearances. But upon further inspection all the furniture was very rickety and the mattresses were AWFUL. The air conditioning unit was frozen solid and they couldn't do anything about it because they were "fully booked". They didn't even offer to discount our bill. The pools were nice and everything was clean though. The staff was friendly, just not very accommodating. Like the title says, the place isnt anything great, just decent. Next time I'll take my $313 (total out the door for 2 nights) to a Disney property.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms, but no housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTravelerRN
Reviews.Content: The rooms at Mike Ditka Resort are more like apartments than rooms. They have a full kitchen w/ granite counter tops, living room, bathroom and bedroom. We have stayed there twice and both units also had a full sized washer and dryer. It is very nice for the price, but there isn't any real housekeeping during your stay. If you want clean towels, you have to bring them to the registration desk, which we would have had to drive to both times we stayed. So we just kept putting our towels in the dryer and re-using them. I guess that's fine, but I don't really want to do laundry while I'm on vacation. They have a nice pool area for the kids. We stayed there for the close proximity to Disney and they do have a shuttle bus, but we didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Good time”
Reviews.Author: naojael
Reviews.Content: We just got back had a great time.. Room was clean excellent location and price. Customer service could definately improve .. But besdides that it was great..

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: ladycane
Reviews.Content: This resort was great! We stayed in a two bedroom villa and had plenty of room for 4 adults and 2 kids. The kitchen is great, there is no on site resturant so we made sure to have snacks and easy to prepare food, there is a super Wal-Mart right buy the hotel (best time to go is early in the morning). The pools were clean and lot's of fun for both the kids and adults. There is a Tiki bar that servers snacks and drinks which is great when you are relaxing by the pool. The staff were friendly and the grounds of the hotel were kept very clean. I highly recommend this resort for famlies and adults it was awesome all around!

Reviews.Title: “"Truely a home away from home"”
Reviews.Author: patscom4
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently returned from spending 6 days at Runaway Beach Club, and I must say we were impressed! To be honest, I was a little leary, as I had read some negative reviews; however, when we arrived we were given a kind welcome and the key to our "room". The "room" was immaculate! There was more space than we had ever expected, and it was truely a home away from home. In fact, our "room" was approximately half the size of our house....it was huge! The beds were quite comfy, the furniture was beautiful, and the kitchen utensils quite useful. Not to mention, there is an abundance of shopping just down the road. The only part that was slightly frustrating was that the hours weren't listed for the tiki bar; but upon our asking, the girl at the desk was glad to give us the bar schedule for the week. In fact, she was kind enough to call us when the bartender came in on his day off to open up the bar!! I will definately stay here if I make a return vacation...It was very affordable, and all 4 of us (including my 14 year old son) had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: jeffjdga
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Ditka's 4 times now. Each time, we have been satisfied with the accomodations, and the staff. If you're staying in Orlando, this is a good place to stay. This time we went to Disney, which was less than 10 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay with the family.”
Reviews.Author: booky131
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice place to go with the family then you should go to Mike Ditka's. Very clean and spacious. We have stayed 3 times and enjoyed it each visit. Keep in mind. If you like peace and quiet book on the second floor. If you are on the first floor the door to the second floor is right by the bedroom and its loud when it closes. My only complaint would be that the tiki bar closes way too early. On our last visit it closed at 9pm and 10 pm the next night. Its very quiet at night. MDCC

Reviews.Title: “The pool was fantastic and the room was nice and tidy.”
Reviews.Author: arlettebianchi
Reviews.Content: This was our second time saying at the resort, and we were glad to book there again. They have a beautiful clean pool, and a kiddie area for the little ones. They added a tiki bar which we were happy to try out, the kids ordered some corn dogs and chips. The room was very clean, and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Ditka's DUMP!!”
