The resort was not anywhere near full, but we were put in a unit that was being roofed and other units near us were being remodeled. There was a family in the unit above us and every step could be heard. Overall we were disappointed. The management only offered to give a good deal on our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere - Dirty/Neglected Facility!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mumzie999
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard unit at an excellent price on Expedia, without housekeeping, for a 4 night stay in mid October 2009. The location was perfect, close to the parks, shopping, eateries etc and the grounds were meticulously cared for. The room we booked was dirty and in desperate need of maintenance/ painting. When we reported the situation to the front desk we were upgraded to a larger room. Front desk staff reminded us,, that we were indeed given the room we booked "On Expedia" and should appreciate the upgrade. OUR EXPECTATION WAS MERELY CLEAN/COMFORABLE AND NOTHING MORE FOR THE PRICE WE PAID!. The upgraded unit was noticeably cleaner but still not not what would be expected in an average hotel (RESORT???????). The bedding/linens were the worst I have EVER seen in a hotel. We were told (contrary to handouts from the property) that we could NOT PURCHASE additional toiletries ($.25 bar of soap to shower) at the front desk "SINCE YOU BOOKED ON EXPEDIA" and were therefore not entitled to such conveniences. Rumours of financial difficulty are no surprise here. What a shame! There is incredible potential for an affordable, well appointed facility, in a great location with fabulous grounds! We would NEVER consider returning under current circumstances or management!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE FOR A FAMILY VACATION”
Reviews.Author: PlaneFamily
Reviews.Content: Cannot Beat The Comfort Of Having A Full Sized Washer And Dryer Inside The Unit. The Rooms Are Very Nicely Decorated, Very Spacious And Comfortable And Include A Full Size Kitchen And Extra Tv In The Living Room So The Kids Can Watch Their Own Stuff..... Only Downside Is Housekeeping Is Not Included, You Need To Pay Extra. We Got A Great Discounted Rate So It Wasnt So Bad To Have To Pay For The Housekeeping. The Kids Pool Is Great, And You Cant Beat The Location.

Reviews.Title: “It Was Fantastic, it is the BEST value in the Disney area!”
Reviews.Author: Omega_Man01
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort every year for the last five years and it has always been very good, after being able to relax in this 2 bedroom 2 bath 1100 plus square foot unit we can’t ever stay in one of the Disney owned overpriced tiny rooms again, we get this huge unit for less than a standard motel room at a moderate Disney resort. It's awesome to put the kids down and be able to close the door to their room, put my feet up and watch TV or a movie in the living room plus they offer a shuttle to Disney World, a business center, an indoor basketball court, a fitness center, an adult pool, and a kids pool to die for as well as movies at night out by the pool. This resort is only 2.5 miles from Disney, 2 miles from the Prime 1 outlet center and less than 1 mile from Wal-Mart, a grocery store and great restaurants. But this time was the best! We finally found the perfect unit and will only stay at this one from now on. It's a 2 bedroom 2 bath corner unit on the ground floor with parking right in front. It's a very short walk when carrying little ones in after a long day at Disney. I'm almost hesitant to give the exact address for fear that I won't get it next time...But here goes. 3002 Limbo Lane unit 102. I promise you will ask for this one again and again! Even if they say they can't guarantee you this one insist on it when you get there. A friend suggested it to me and I owe him big time! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Prettybrwneyes09
Reviews.Content: I payed extra for house keeping and they never did there job. They never left shampoo,dish soap, new kitchen towels, coffee ect... They were so lazy and just threw towels on the floor in the bathroom..didnt put them up on the rack. We acually had to call down to the front desk to ask for more toilet paper because we ran out when the maid was in there a hour before that. If you cant do steps..DONT STAY HERE. right when you walk into your villa you have to walk up like 20 steps..my mom has bad knee's and had such a hard time. I called down to see if we could get switched and he said that Cheaprooms new how there villa layouts were set up and its there fault they didnt tell me..The manager was very rude and did absolutly NOTHING to try and make my stay better. He told me i could upgrade..but i'd have to pay extra every night. The pool was so cold you couldnt even stick your feet in.which really sucked because i have a 2 year old daughter who was dying to go swimming. Over all it was a alright stay.. nice size villa for your money. Full kitchen and a living room and a washer and dryer...just dont waste your money with the House keeping. it was just terrible..the only thing they'd do was the bed and change the whole 2 little trash cans in the whole villa.

Reviews.Title: “Guard your personal property. Dismissive, non-responsive management.”
Reviews.Author: JGStPetersburg
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Mike Ditka Resorts Runaway Beach Club while our 12-year-old daughter participated in a soccer tournament. Her iPod and digital camera were stolen from her backpack after a Resort employee removed her backpack from the pool area (without her consent) while the pool was open. The General Manager was very dismissive when we reported the incident, telling us that unless an employee admitted stealing the items, there was nothing the Resort would do. The Executive Manager told us to file a police report (which we did), and the CEO, Guest Services and other members of management did not return our phone calls or respond to our comment card, e-mails or letters. No explanation, no apology, no offer to even partially reimburse our daughter for her $300 loss. If you stay at a Mike Ditka resort or other property managed by Geneva Hospitality, LLC, guard your property! And don’t bother reporting any problems to general or executive management because you will not get a response.

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Julie J
Reviews.Content: I hope to help fellow travelers out by relating my experience at the Mike Ditka Runaway Beach resort. I checked in at almost 11pm and asked for a quiet room for myself, me being a middle aged lady. There were several building units with not a single car in front of them, yet they chose to put me in a unit with a few cars in front, which meant they were occupied. Not a big deal, but why not allow me to stay in a quiet, unrented unit? Too far for the maids to walk? I don’t know. I opened the door to the unit and there was this long stairway- 21 steps up to my living area/bedroom. Now let me ask you, would you put a 50 year old lady traveling along with 2 heavy suitcases in a room where you have to hand lug your baggage up these steps? There is no elevator, keep in mind. I had driven to the unit and it was too much of a hassle to load up car and drive back to the check-in desk. It had taken 20 minutes to check in, and I was the only one there. So, I lugged them up the stairs. There was no coffee filter for my coffee pot in my room the next morning when I woke up. I called the front desk, I can barely function without my coffee in the morning. First they said that not all rooms get filters since I didn’t have the daily maid service with my rental. I told the front desk that it was my first day there, and I have not used any filters to begin with. She said she would send one over. It never came. I went to Epcot and stopped by the front desk to ask them to please put a coffee filter in my room, or would I be able to grab one from there reception desk coffee area. They said they would put one in my room. Upon returning home from Epcot, I was dead tired and checked the kitchen for a coffee filter. There was none there. I called the front desk, and they said they would “get one to me soon”. An hour later I called back to cancel the filter drop off because it was 10pm and I was ready for bed. They said, “oh, it is on the way right now”. !0 mintues later it was there. Why is it so hard to get a filter? I asked for one so many times, yet nothing. Very frusterating. The next day I planned on doing a little laundry and driving down to Tampa, for a conference. I put my close in the wash, and plugged in my computer to do some work online, and charge my phone. The power went out at approximately 830am. I called the front desk, they said they would fix it soon. I made it clear that I really needed the power working because of my work online, the laundry, and the dark bathroom where I still needed to shower. Also, I did not bring my phone car charger for the rental car, thinking I would have power on my trip. The power never came on, so I called back after an hour and a half, just before my computer battery ran out, and they finally agreed to let me use another room to finished my laundry and take a shower. By the way, the front desk person told me the wrong password for the high-speed internet access, and it took about an hour of guessing what it might be... (no caps, and no parenthesees, which they told me I must use to access the internet) When I checked out, I asked to speak to the manager to let him know what an inconvenience this whole stay had been, but he was conveniently in a meeting. The front desk person said he would call me within a half hour, which he never did. Thru all the confusion, I left my phone charger in the wall in the room. I called about 3 hours after checkout when I realized it was gone and they said they would check with the maid and call me back. They never did. I will NEVER stay at this place again. Not only did I have a horrible experience, but the place is shabby. There was mismatched paint, dings in the floorboards and walls the place is just put together haphazardly. There were pubic hairs on my bath towels, the light switches and other fixtures are not screwed in well, the phone in the bedroom had a cord going nowhere, when I pulled back the bed to plug it in, there was no phone outlet for it! The dresser in the bedroom was missing a knob to pull out the drawer, and the air conditioning unit was very complicated to set the right temperature, it had all these timer settings that were locked in and difficult to figure out the over-ride. I also should mention there is no restaurant, and there is no room service. Even the vending machines in the lobby were poorly stocked- completely out of bottled water. Thank goodness I had my own car so I would not have to cab it to a store each time I wanted water. So, as you can see, I am rating this place terrible, which it was.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay for us - we will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: DaveandKathyCyprus
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed here and meets all our expectations. It is not a hotel, although if anything the servicing of the rooms has improved. Clean, comfortable, quiet, a good location for all the parks and excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Spacious, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: wdw_73
Reviews.Content: You find the usual glitches that come with properties that where individual units are owned by individuals and rented by the management company - inadequate staff, spotty housekeeping, and round treatement by the "guests" that seem to feel that being on vacation means a license to destroy property. To the good, not too far from WDW maingate, access to plenty of restaurants and touristy shopping, right across from Walmart, which has an amazingly good takeout selection as well as a Redbox dvd rental kiosk, fully and nicely equipped full kitchen with spacious eat-in dining nook, whole lotta square footage very reasonably priced - a pleasant shock after 30 years of on Disney property rooms. Major outstanding disappointment - the pool area. Too small to accomodate guests, and blasts very rude and obnoxious "music" over entire area, even the kiddie pool, where I attempted to escape the assault upon my ears. If the type of lyrics you enjoy include acts of misogyny, murder, and mahem, by all means, bring your own chair and stay all day. If you don't, bring noise cancelling earphones, and a sound proof plastic bubble for your kids. Oh, and did I mention that this travesty called "music" is provided via radio station, so that the commercials are equally loud and offensive. Perhaps only a coma can block out the offense that the air holds. Overall well rated, just stay the HELL away from the pool!

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could live here!!”
Reviews.Author: jnjdewey
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely AMAZING!! We stayed here for our honeymoon and it was perfect. We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom for free! I loved the kitchen and the washer and dryer. The fact that there is a Wal Mart right down the road is awesome too! We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We picked a really winner by staying here!”
Reviews.Author: pjgaltrips
Reviews.Content: Seven of us (4 adults and 3 children ages 9,10,11) spent a short but "SUHWEET!" one nighter at Ditka's Resorts Runaway Beach Club following a fun but exhausting Disney Cruise and a surprise last vacation day at Universal for our boys this past spring break in April. I'd found and reserved the resort online and since I only had online information and picturess to rely on (which can sometimes be misleading), I called the resort's front desk several times before our trip for reassurance that I'd made a good choice for our stay. Each time I called, I spoke with "ubber" friendly staff who eagerly answered ALL of my questions in a very professional and helpful manner! Still, the price for the quality we were paying for seemed too good to be true, so as our trip's planner, I remained nervous until we checked into our condo. Check in was a breeze and the front gate security was a nice benefit to our stay. Our condo looked new and freshly painted and beautifully appointed! The kitchen was pretty; large and open, as was every room, including the bathrooms! What a relief it was after our long trip to be able to stay here; we felt pampered by the fresh (and quiet) accommodations Ditka's provided us. In fact we were refreshed to the point that once we dropped off our bags and ate some snacks, we went exploring. There is a nice shopping center within walking distance and we also found a good steak restaurant within a short drive. We were very impressed and the best part of of our stay was that my clan told me I should be a travel agent for finding such an impressive value. Will most DEFINATLY stay there again. Congrats to Mike Ditka on this terrific resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Love it!! Best home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: HappyMommyto3
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome!! I can never ever stay in a regular hotel room again after having the luxury of room in this place!! Perfect for bug families! I took my three children there to celebrate my Daughters Birthday. We had the most amazing time!! The resort is beautiful and very accomidating. It was conviently located to many stores, Resturants and the theme parks. We spent a very memorable morning at your resort, with a coffee cake w/ candles for my 4 year olds Birthday. We sang, ate, and opened presents at our mini party befroe hitting Disney for the day. I love this resort because it is clean, comfortable, very roomy, and has all the comforts of being at home. We will for sure be back to celebrate many more Birthdays in the future. I will recommend your place to everyone I know that plans on traveling to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Serene & Fun-Filled Home-Away-From-Home in the Disney Area - www.runawaybeachhotel.com, [- -]”
Reviews.Author: PFamilyUsa
Reviews.Content: It is with the utmost honor and sincere pleasure that our family forward this “praise report” of the outstanding professional service and warm hospitality received from the entire staff at Mike Ditka Resorts Runaway Beach Club. The peaceful “home-away-from-home” atmosphere was so addictive that after we relocated to a popular Disney resort for 2 nights, our children literally begged to return to the quiet serenity, as they longed to continue relaxing around the pool and pond areas which both echoed the meditative trinkling of their water fountains. Our family really appreciated the resort’s careful attention to all the details that made our stay stress-free, such as “Dive-In” movies around the pool at night, a Playstation with video games, DVD movies, separate children’s pool with waterfalls, cabana deck area, a gym, video arcade, an indoor basketball court, a gift/grocery shop, fully equipped kitchen with all cleaning supplies and a private washer/dryer with detergent. The staff patiently attended to every question and concern that we posed, and always went out of their way to provide solutions for us, no matter how unique the issue; like kindly navigating us back “home” when we were stuck/lost late at night after missing the resorts’ free shuttle long after the Disney park closed. For small yet critical assistance such as this, we’ll be forever grateful to the wonderfully sincere staff at the Mike Ditka Resorts Runaway Beach Club. A special thanks goes out to the resort’s very compassionate front desk personnel, specifically the manager Richard, Juan, Kammy, Dana and Jessinia. Again, it is with humbled gratitude that we forward this submission on behalf of the Mike Ditka Resorts Runaway Beach Club, as we sing its praises to all those seeking a serene yet fun-filled “home-away-from-home” resort, at an incredibly discounted price. In Much Appreciation, P. Family Washington, D.C., USA

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't be paid to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Oasisyouthgroup
Reviews.Content: If I could rate this hotel's service a 0, I would. Recently myself and my youth group attended a church competition in Orlando, Fl. We are from Tampa and traveled to Orlando to stay for a couple of days. Our Pastor booked this hotel for an excellent rate of $99 a room, per night. We had two, two-bedroom villas, for two nights. The total came to a little over $400. It was a great price. After staying there, I now understand why it was so cheap. The rooms were nice, spacious and fairly comfortable. Some of the beds weren't fantastic, but it wasn't unbearable. The first thing I noticed was that the guy who was working the front desk could not have been more than 22 years old. So I figured it was just a family type business and brushed it aside because he was very friendly. Later on in the first night, we realized we didn't have enough towels for all the kids. We had 10 girls in our room, which with the sleep sofas, fit pretty comfortably. So I called down to the front desk to ask for more towels, and they told me that because we had not chosen to have housekeeping for the reservation they would have to charge us for the towels. Upon asking for the price of the towels, I was told it would be 23 dollars a day. Now, our reservation confirmation listed that 10 people would be in one room. So obviously the hotel staff knew this information as well. But we were only given 6 towels. Needless to say, they were literally charging us to bathe. Obviously I declined the towel service, we just decided to recycle the towels we had. Later we ran out of toilet paper. We were originally given one roll of toilet paper per bathroom (2 bathrooms total). So we had two rolls of toilet paper for 10 girls/women to use over the course of 2 days. When we called to say we had run out of toilet paper, they charged us per roll. WHO CHARGES FOR TOILET PAPER? So by this point, we had been charged to take showers and go to the bathroom. You think that if the resort knew how many people were staying in a room withOUT the housekeeping option, they would stock it fairly well. But apparently not. The same first night, we realized we had not blankets or pillows for the sleeper sofas. It took an hour for the pillows to arrive, even though the front desk was a two-minute walk from our room. So when we requested for sheets (surprisingly they did not charge us for these) it took well over an hour, so I called again. The lady at the front desk rudely informed me that housekeeping left at 7, and it was our responsibility to call before then. Like we were supposed to know what time housekeeping went home? So I said that we need the blankets to sleep (this was well after midnight, and we had a performance early the next morning). I, and my girls, just wanted some sleep. So after waiting another hour, a knock finally arrives at the door, and it's the security guard. He brought us pillow cases. Not sheets. So we told him we didn't need those and that we asked for sheets. Needless to say I called the front desk again and the lady huffed and puffed about how the night shift literally consisted of herself and the security guard. TWO PEOPLE RUNNING AN ENTIRE RESORT. How unsafe is that? The security guard couldn't even do his actual job because he was doing housekeeping's. By about 1am we finally got our sheets and were able to go to bed. The next day I went to the front desk and asked to speak with the housekeeping manager. She once again tried to charge me for towels, at which point I said "Okay, you didn't even give us enough towels for how many people are in the room, we're not going to let you charge us to take showers". She finally said she would have the towels sent down. 4 HOURS LATER they had not arrived. So I called again, and when she finally brought them, she was once again very rude and was rolling her eyes at me. Now, I am a Hospitality major in college. I plan to work at a hotel one day. I know what is worthy of a complaint and what is not, considering my future career. But this was just ridiculous. I don't like complaining about service, I feel bad. But I did not feel bad at all at this "resort" because of how rude the staff was. It seemed like bringing us towels to bathe, toilet paper to use the bathroom, and sheets to sleep on, was such an inconvenience. THESE THINGS ARE NECESSITIES. Now, if they had told us at the beginning that we should bring our own towels and blankets because we didn't have housekeeping, we could have been more prepared and been able to avoid some of these problems. But they didn't even tell us that. It was horrible. The last day, housekeeping walks into the boys room at 7am because it was our checkout day. The decided that even though 11am was checkout time, it was okay to go into the rooms 4 hours earlier to see if we had left yet. Now, I think common sense would tell someone that if checkout is at 11am, housekeeping should not even enter the room until at least 11:15am. When we finally were leaving the room at 10:45, the maids were literally waiting outside our door to finish up. I have NEVER experienced anything like that. I travel quite frequently, and to various hotels, but I have never once seen a maid standing at the door waiting for you to leave, and again, before checkout time. It was clear that they wanted us to hurry up and get out so she could start cleaning our room. It was visibly an inconvenience for her. She clearly hated her job. After we left, two of the boys realized they left their bathing suits in the dryer. When we called to see if housekeeping found them, the hotel informed us that they had THROWN THEM AWAY. HOUSEKEEPING SHOULD NEVER THROW BELONGINGS AWAY. Especially a mere few hours after checkout! Any items found should immediately go to lost and found, and then MAYBE after a couple months, be disposed of. To say I was pissed, would be an understatement. I will never stay at this "resort" again. I wouldn't even call it a resort. I'd just call it a terrible experience. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, not even someone I hated. The service was beyond awful, and those people don't even deserve to have that job. I think that resort should be shut down immediately, and turned into something that actually produces an enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer Service”
Reviews.Author: chicago672
Reviews.Content: While the room is wonderful, large and clean the service and the staff are terrible. There are never any towels at the pool and when you ask for more they never show up. Our VCR would not work and we called for directions on how the get it to work and they told us "how hard is it to work a VCR". The front desk staff truly does not care if you are there or not, so do yourself a favor and stay where someone cares about your business.

Reviews.Title: “The best family place to stay - Thank you again for the best time of our lives!!”
Reviews.Author: srockwell31
Reviews.Content: This is the best suggested place to stay for family in my opinion. This was our 2nd time visitng the resort and I can honestly say that we were very impresed with the overall stay and very impressed with all the staff that works there. Everyone is always very friendly and you can even check out as late as noon. My children are always excited when they hear they are going and you don't even need to go anywhere because you have everything you need at the resort. They supply all the necessary equipment in the kitchen so you can take your own food and cook. My children are only 10 and 11 and they are just as happy hanging out at the resort. The pool is always warm and they have a hot tub. They have shaded areas so you don't have to sit and in the direct heat. you can sit back and relax when your children are having fun in the pool. I think that for the price you pay, it is definately worth it. The rooms are non smoking but you can stand outside and smoke. The pictures on the website look just the same as they do in the resort. I don't know about you but there is nothing worse than seeing hotel pictures (of other places) and then showing up and the rooms looking very different and disappinting. not at Mike ditka! The master bedroom has a very nice large bathtub. Perfect for spending some time with your loved one :) Thankyou for again for the best time ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GIVE THEM YOUR MONEY FOR DEPOSIT”
Reviews.Author: LaurieCanada
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation May 2008 for a 8 day vacation for March 2009 and gave them a $200 deposit. Had to cancell my vacation and was told that the deposit was credited to my Visa. I have a cancellation number and have talked to accounting and many managers and still do not have a credit. I don't know what to do next! DO NOT GIVE THIS RESORT ANY MONEY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and great value with a lot of space - good deal for sports teams”
Reviews.Author: solarstar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with a sports team, so reserved six two-bedroom villas. I was a bit worried due to some of the reviews but didn't experience anything negative. Check-in was easy (used reduced rate on expedia) as was check-out. The rooms were clean and attractive, and we especially appreciated the washer and dryer (as well as the 3 separate tv's in each villa). It was convenient to drive to shopping and restaurants (none were within walking distance). Pools seemed smaller than the photos on the website but were kept clean and the indoor (air conditioned) basketball court was heavily used by the kids. The beds seemed very comfortable and the large bathroom in the king bed suite was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location near Disneyland”
Reviews.Author: Jaideeprao
Reviews.Content: I was at the Mike Ditka's Runaway beach resort with my co-workers from the workplace and absolutely had a great time in Orlando-Kissimee. They did a smooth 15 minute check-in at 3 AM in the morning after we drove in from Atlanta,GA. The resort itself is very convenoently located close to Disney parks and i would recommend this especially for a small group as the villa-apartment type units come with a fully equipped kitchen, big screen television, good climate control(air conditioning) ample parking space and socializing areas within one's own apartment. House keeping has scope for improvement as it was really some wait before we could get the utensils cleaned and the beds made again. We were a group of 5 friends and had a good time there. The resort has an excellent poolside area where one can carry his drink and have a poolside table to spend time. The location is good, felt secure and the reception staff were very helpful. Don't miss the excellent brochures stocked up for visitors at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Delight”
Reviews.Author: twinmom296
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our last night at Disneyworld. We were exhausted and needed to stay close to Disneyworld but out of the park. We were very unsure when we first arrived on what to expect. We were very pleasantly surprised. The front desk staff were very friendly but definitely had a hard time finding our reservation and after several minutes they finally gave us key cards to a nice little house. As soon as we got to the house it started sprinkling and they key cards would not work to let us in. We went back to the front desk and they gave us new cards to try and they still didn't work. Meanwhile we are getting rained on. Finally they volunteered to upgrade us from a two bedroom to a three bedroom at no extra cost with a playstation and loft with gameroom for the kids. Wow what a great gesture! When we arrived the inside was spectacular and it had a washer and dryer inside we used alot after 5 days in the rain at disneyworld. They had a great pool and the kids had a blast! The front desk staff even helped us with directions and anything else we needed. There is a lovely little lake surrounding the property and all in all it is a beautiful place. Definitely would go back in a heart beat. We had 6 people in our party and only paid $110.00 for the night and had a lot of room for everyone. Great Value

Reviews.Title: “We found the service extremely poor”
Reviews.Author: didi1944
Reviews.Content: First I must list the things we liked: location was great, check in and out was quick and pleasant and the rates we got through Hotels.com was compatiable. However the things we found during our 4 day stay make it unpleasent. We got in late so we didn't notice until the next morning that the coffee maker was broken and so was the ice machine. The beds make lots of noise which made it impossible to get a good night sleep and the pillows were small also the linen didn't smell fresh. One of the toilets was sluggish in flushing, one remote control would not work and one was missing. The bathtub had no non slipping tapes on it and it was slippery on getting in and out. When we got up the next morning the ice maker had overflowed over and there was water on the kitchen and on the carpet where the dining table was.We call housekeeping and informed them when a technician came to fix the ice maker and he told us that it was the wrong one inserted and they had lots of trouble with a lot of them. We feel that this should have been replaced knowing this. We were on our way out by the time he came and he said it would be fixed by the afternoon, it was not.. They did bring a new coffee maker, but did not remove the old one or the box. When we returned, we went to the front desk and inquired about coffee or dishwashing soap and the attendant told us that we had to buy our own. We had to request face cloths we had none and the simple ammenties that are usually offered at better hotels were not given. We had to call several times to no avail. We were extremely dissatisfied with the service. Also the cable service was limited viewing channels. The front door had the bottom metal loose and my granddaughter cut her foot as she walked by on our way out. We feel that our vacation stay at your hotel made it an pleasant experience. We were disappointed so much as we had heard about your hotel from friends and reading the reviews. Well I am sorry to say, they were wrong.

Reviews.Title: “What a joke”
Reviews.Author: FLABRATZ
Reviews.Content: I could have stayed at a red roof inn and paid alot less. Just checked out today 5-25-09. I got a 1 bedroom place with no a/c and the fan was so loud I couldn't run it. The microwave didn't work and my son ended up with PINK EYE for the sheets/pillow. Don't waste your money this place is a dump. At checked I didn't understand my bill and the guy at the desk goes I don't understand it either, Online I thought I was paying 110 a night it turned out to be 195 a night and nothing worked. I'm in South Florida and travel to Orlando alot and this is the first time and last time staying at this place please please people don't waste your money. I have a kid with pink eye because of this stay. Talk about a worthless resort they don't even have a place to eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly managed, unresponsive to guests needs, no one in charge”
Reviews.Author: llstark37
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 11:30. Check in was 4. Although we rented 3 units for 4 nights, they couldn't manage to clean up a single 1 bedroom unit. We checked in at 4:30. I asked for a public bathroom in the lobby. There was 4 inches of water on the floor. The receptionist smiled and said she knew about it. I told her then she should have it mopped up and a sign warning people of the wet floor. We had a Fed Ex delivery sent to us. Although the staff signed for it, they couldn't find it the next day until after we'd already left for the parks. Park tickets were enclosed. Check in was inefficient and time consuming. Clean up consists of spreading out the blanket on top of the bed and fresh towels. It takes under 5 min. per unit. This was done at 5:40 P.M. Why bother at all, at that late hour?

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad.”
Reviews.Author: MetsFan14
Reviews.Content: We did arrive about 30 minutes prior to check-in time, so I was expecting to have to wait a little bit, and they told me the room was not ready and that it should be ready within an hour. That was no problem, and my entire family was starving anyway. We went to eat and returned to the hotel about 2 hours later. The two people working the front desk were very nice, but also very overwhelmed with the phone ringing off the hook and with the other 2 people on line waiting for their room. Long story short, I waited at the front desk for another 45 mins until the room was ready. I can't be sure, but it seemed they overbooked, and from the whispering I heard between the workers, it sounded like the two people on line behind me who were waiting for their reserved rooms (same room type as me) were going to get shafted. The room itself was very nice, very roomy. The pullout sofa bed was so uncomfortable, I just slept on the couch. That didn't bother me at all, but just know that the sofabed is very uncomfortable. The beds in the rooms were very comfortable. The second day of our 6 day stay, we discovered that the washing machines spin cycle didn't work, resulting in SOAKING wet clothes which were a pain to dry. I called the front desk and they assured me it would be looked at. I called again when we returned to the hotel our next night there after noticing nothing was done, and I was reassured that it would be taken care of. Needless to say, we checked out 3 days later and it was never even looked at, let alone corrected. On the bright side, the pool area was very nice and the kids loved it. The grounds are very well taken care of and the hotel is close to EVERYTHING (rent a car...it made everything very convenient). Disney parks are 10-15 mins away. Universal about 20 mins. Tons of shopping and dining options to choose from within a mile or two. If you take away the long wait for check-in and the broken washing machine, it was a great place. I don't let little things like that ruin my vacation anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Rooms need some Renovations”
Reviews.Author: perfectlyfrank
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a 3 BR with loft for 5 adults and 1 child. When we checked in, we discovered that our original room was TOO HOT. The temp on the thermostat said 85 degrees. We were moved to a regular 3 BR on the first floor. It was wonderful, cool, fairly clean, and conveniently located close to the pool. But since there are many kids that stay here, a 1st floor unit is noisier than a 2nd floor one. The only time it was a problem was around 11pm, when the movie at the pool let out and the teens rushed up the stairs making noises. On the PLUS side, there is a kitchen with stove, fridge, microwave. For only $180/nite, you can have at least 6 people stay in the 3BR unit. That is a GREAT deal compared to traditional hotels. On the MINUS side, when you don't stay at Disney, you are stuck taking the shuttle, which only departs 3 times in the morning and returns 3 times at night. Or you have to fight the traffic and pay $13 to park. All in all, this place is worth the price if you can overlook the dust. But you aren't paying for a Marriott either.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but not as nice as other places in the area”
Reviews.Author: love2vaca-fl
Reviews.Content: This place is a good value, but they lack the attention to detail. Our room was a second floor room. You walk in the door and the stairs to go up are right in front of you. I didn't really care for that - since I had a 2 year old with me. So, at night we blocked the stairs with the chairs from the dining room. Our couch had a stain on the cushion, I just flipped it over so we didn't have to see it. And the molding around the front door was rotting away. We also had a broke tile in the entrance way. We have stayed at MUCH nicer places in the area for a little bit more. I do know people that have stayed her that really liked it. Maybe they just never stayed anywhere nicer and have nothing to compare it to.

Reviews.Title: “First stay was great, Second changed my opinion”
Reviews.Author: Addicted2Trvl
Reviews.Content: My self, spouse and son stayed here about a year ago, on the second floor. Apparently this is the key, whenever I see great reviews I wonder where their unit was. This time we stayed on the first floor. Walls and ceiling are paper thin, so much so that I actually woke in the middle of the night thinking that someone was in our living room having a conversation when it was actually the people above us. They were not being excpetionally loud either. This happened both nights we were there after midnight when they returned from their days activities, good thing they were not revealing any personal information because I could hear them so well, it was like I was sitting there with them. The resort appearance is very nice, with a great pool, clean rooms and a great location, this is where it ends, our ice maker didn't work, and there was no cable running from the DVD to the TV making it useless (we took movies for the evening since they advertise DVD players). I called the office 2 times the first night requesting a cable, and stopped by the second night, even watched the office staff hand the maintenance man the work order (he also heard the issue), we NEVER recieved a cable or even a call to explain why we had no cable. While we were checking out a lady was asking when they were going to replace her coffee maker and stated that this was her third day without one. The bad overrides the good for us here and we will not be staying again,

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for those looking for a home away for home with a great value!”
Reviews.Author: misshelicopter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to the Orlando area to visit relatives and were looking for a convenient place to call our home for 6 days and 5 nights. We spent two weeks looking for the perfect place that wouldn't be over crowded nor have small rooms. I had never stayed in a condo before so this was our first adventure. When we arrived we were greeted with the friendly staff who, in under 5 minutes, had us checked into our room and given us our keys. Our condo was in building 11 and was a 1 bedroom, 1 bath upstairs. It was great to have our own private entrance with a staircase, along with a full kitchen with washer & dryer, dining and living room with TV and pullout sofa, and a huge bedroom with a walk in closet and large bathroom. We even had a doorbell and newspaper delivered Mon-Fri. The parking lot was pretty empty for a few days but even when more cars came in it wasn't difficult to find a spot -- and it was nice to park just feet away from our front door! The community is gated which made me feel safer at night and the pool is open until 11pm! There is even a basketball court and workout gym. The condo was situated very close to shopping (walmart supercenter and publix within 5mins) and freeways. We were also about 10 minutes from Disney and 20 minutes from downtown Orlando. Everyday we had a housecleaner who would tidy up the bathroom, bedroom and living spaces including taking out the trash and even organizing our mess! I would definitely stay again, no questions asked.

Reviews.Title: “simply the best”
Reviews.Author: gregharris
Reviews.Content: we had agreat time in your beach club we stayed at runnaway beach club in kissimmee fl. and it was more than we expected it was beautiful and our stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of space to stretch out”
Reviews.Author: coyoteman
Reviews.Content: We loved it. I went with my family, 4 kids and we loved having the extra space. Full kitchen, 2 bathrooms and lots of room to relax. Great Pool and play area. Our kids quickly met friends poolside and looked forward to getting back to the hotel just as much as they enjoyed Disney World, so mom and dad got lots of R&R as well. This resort is close to the airport and very close to the parks. Walking distance to a full service Walmart. Lots of restaurants very very close by. If you are not driving I do recommend renting a car. It is not much more than the cost of the shuttle and it adds so much flexibility to your trip

Reviews.Title: “It was like a home away from home - But only BETTER!”
Reviews.Author: jewelcrowe
Reviews.Content: We did a ton or research on different places in the Disney area before making a reservation. We have been to Florida quite a few times and have always been feeling like our accomodations lacked in one way or another. I found this place on the internet and went to many different sites to read the reviews and check out the pictures. We finally decided that this was the one for us. Talk about a great decision! We couldn't have been more thrilled. The staff that greeted us were friendly and very helpful. We were checked in within minutes and when we got to our Villa, we were enchanted by the adorable "neighborhood". There was tond of parking and everyday we were able to park right outside our door without issue. The place has a security gate so only peple staying there can drive in. The vila was even better than we had expected. It was roomy, modern, clean and the decor was quite nice. The kitchen was stocked with all the essentials for cooking and dining. The beds were comfortable and the kids had a seperate bathroom from us. There was also a TV in the livingroom and each bedroom as well as a dvd player in the living room. The temperature controlls were very easy to use and were digital and also programable to your needs throughout the differnt times of the day. The pool area was very nice and clean and was never crowded. The atmosphere was great. The 2 pools were very nice and my kids and I enjoyed them immensley. The landscaping around the area was very nice and you can tell that the resort is well taken care of. We couldn't have been happier. After reading other people's reviews and seeing how some people had been disappointed because it was not what they expected, I just wanted to take a moment to tell you what to expect so that you do not find yourself in the same boat. This place is like a nice family style neighborhood with quiet safe streets and cute little houses. This is just like living at home. You cook your own meals because there is no restaurant on the premises....but there are a ton of them in the area. The maid comes in each day and brings fresh towels, makes the beds and takes out the garbage. Just like at home, if you make a mess, you clean it up. If you dirty the dishes, you clean them. They even leave you a vacuum in case you make a mess of the carpet and wish to vacuum. This is not a resort where you are pampered. If that is what you are looking for, then this is not the place for you. If you wish to stay in a relaxing area with all the amenities of home with some added perks, then you will love this place. We absolutely loved this place. We took a ton of pictures, have already shown them to all our friends and have recommended this place to all of them for their future visits in Florida. We will definately be going back for our vacation next year. We couldn't have been more pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: CRTowny
Reviews.Content: My husband had a weeklong conference in Orlando, so we took the kids out of preschool and came to sunny Florida from the snowy north. This timeshare property is pretty and the location, a block away from an entrance to the Oceola Parkway (which gets you to Disney World in about 5 minutes) can't be beat. The units themselves could use some TLC, however. We stayed in a three-bedroom, two bath unit, on the ground floor. Let me warn you, if you have small children or light sleepers, this is not the place for you. The walls (and ceilings) are paper thin. Some of the units have video game systems included and we were entertained by the young girls upstairs, singing until the wee hours of the morning. There is a full sized kitchen, but we had to buy a frying pan to fix eggs and pancakes...only pots in 3 sizes were provided. There were not any baking pans either, just a pizza sheet. There were, however, plenty of plates, cups and silverware provided, as well as an ice machine in the freezer. The floors in our unit were filthy; living room, bathrooms, kitchen....our feet stayed black, and only a broom and vacuum were provded, no mop. The sofas in the living room felt greasy, as if lots of people had sat on them with suntan lotion on. The arms of the blue sofas were black with dirt. All in all, the location of this hotel is great, but it needs a good deep cleaning more often than it's getting. Next time, we'll stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and poor customer service---stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: steve1997
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed for one night, thank God!!! I had called hotel the night before our arrival and requested an early check in, I was told no problem. We arrived later than I had asked and room was still not ready, I was told there was NO way anyone could have told me that on the phone and I should call or come back in 2 hours (so I was accused of lying in a nice way). So I called and they said room was STILL not ready so they would "upgrade" us to a larger room that WAS ready upon the initial arrival. So we went back and checked in. The resort looked very nice at first glance but the closer you looked you could tell the property was not very well maintained. The room we had was a 2 bedroom condo with a loft. It was very large but thats all it had going for it. There were dirty towels hung behind both bathroom doors, clumps of hair behind toliets, broken towel racks and ceiling plaster hanging down in one of the bedrooms. We went down to front desk to complain and were told to come back the next morning and talk to the general manager. We awoke the next morning and decided to look around in the kitchen when we opened the oven, to our total disgust, there was a broiling pan with hardened grease in it and a rack on top of the pan with food hanging down. GROSS!!! So we immediately went down to the front desk to find the general manger. We told him our problems and he of course apologized and said he was going to give us a "credit" for the nights' stay and assured us that it was an isolated incident and wanted to make it up to us. He gave us a "special" rate on the same room if we came back again, we reluctantly decided to give him another chance and paid for another stay set for 2 weeks later. One week went by and we did not see a credit so we called him numerous times and he never called us back, finnaly we did get him on the phone and we asked where our credit was and he told us that he gave us a partial credit of $22.60 on a $100.00 stay. Thats not what we were told so we argued our point and he said we had to pay the tax anyways on the room. I then asked him well if I was to puchase something at Wal-Mart and returned it for a refund they would also refund my tax, his response was I quote "I do not work at Wal-Mart and I do not know their return policy" come on!!! Everyone know when you return something the store does NOT keep the tax you paid. His response was ignorant and cocky. So we decided to cancel our pending stay and will NEVER go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Cute Decore, Great for Families, But Some Cleanliness Issues”
Reviews.Author: 2TravelerNuts
Reviews.Content: Great for families! If your going to stay for a week or two with the kids, book this one. It has a time share feel to it. We did not check out the pools, no time. The style is a relaxing beachy feel. The price was great for what we got! It felt like we were staying in someone's home, cozy! The downfalls: there was lack of attention to details that would would find in a nicer resort. Like lightbulbs that were out. A lamp did not work at all. The carpet needs to be replaced. The front entrance way was filthy! These would be easy to overlook if kids were there. Would not recommend for a romantic get away. Overall I would still recommend it! Warning: it's adjacent to a highway that requires tolls on and off (coins only with not person, so bring the change bucket).

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: willieboyzern
Reviews.Content: I booked through Jet Blue and first booked at Mike Ditka's Lighthouse Key Resort...little did I know they can change reservations. Didn't like that aspect, since I rec'd an email stating they no longer could provide a suite for my family of 5 but offered one at Runaway. When I called to confirm, it was a bit cheaper and they refunded the difference. I wanted to know if they had cribs, washers, etc...and the woman at the desk seemed bothered and annoyed, and could not offer me any specific info. I called Management, which did get back to me right away, said he'd upgrade my room, have a gift waiting (which I did not want, just wanted to make sure hotel was clean, a 4 star like Lighthouse, which it isn't, it's a 3 star). Anyway, upon checking in, there was no upgrade, and we had to wait 3 hours for a room. Needless to say I was po'd!!! The suite (2 br) was nice, spacious, comfortable, but only after I cleaned everything w/Clorox. Surface clean, but it looked they use a mop made of human hair. Once clean, it was nice...after all that!

Reviews.Title: “The Steggall Family's Review”
Reviews.Author: miss_igirisu
Reviews.Content: Very clean, comfortable and has plenty of room for the 6 of us (2 bedded loft included). Convenient and less than a mile from supermarket (Wallmart) and many restaurants (including Ponderosa buffet breakfast at the end of the road). The only problem was that it was hard to find; poorly signed from the road. Very nice stay and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Resort, well stock rooms!”
Reviews.Author: chrisy r
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and cozy! They seemed liked condos and had a full kitchen with everything needed for eating, cooking. The bed in the room was comfortable although i only layed on it once as i got the pull out sleeper sofa. The pull out sofa is the worst i've ever slept on and hurt me a bit. The TVs are nice however and overall i was happy with the rooms. The pool area is laid out well with lounge chairs around the pool as well as on a sundeck. Music is piped in and creates a relaxing island atmosphere! There were FAR too many children though (yes, i know it is disney area) and i didn't stay in the pool for long during the day time. The staff was friendly enough though they seemed unconcerned with guest questions or requests. Overall the rooms were above average and i liked being able to cook my vegan meals and snacks there. The walk to the pool was pleasant and the music an added bonus. i would stay here again because i dig the condo like set up of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: matts19832
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from October 17 to 31 and it was absolutely amazing. I went with my girlfriend, my parents, my aunt and my 7 year old cousin and everyone of us loved it so it is great for everyone. We had a three bedroom villa, house 204 in building 8 and it was a perfect base camp. The staff were helpful and friendly and the only downside was that there was no bar or restaurant on site. Only a 20 min walk from sharky's sports bar as well, where it was $3 for a double vodka and red bull (being from the UK where that would cost around £6/$11) I was in heaven. I hope to revisit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Stay”
Reviews.Author: NJwkidz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Runaway Beach Club the first week in November. We stayed there the previous year the same week, we even chose to stay in the same 2 bedrm, second floor unit, which my kids thought was a cool idea. We were totally pleased last year, and I am happy to report it was very good this year. The unit shows a bit of wear, and the AC return grille needed a good vacuuming but otherwise it was the same. The location is great and very convenient to fast shopping for food. This is not a resort, it has a nice pool and deck area (which we didnt even visit this year), but not alot going on which we like, it is quiet and relaxing after a day at the parks. We eat breakfast and some dinners in the unit depending on how exhausted we are. My 2 boys 6 and 10 are happy to return from the parks have dinner and watch a movie. The unit has has a washer and dryer so we travel there very light. Our check in and check out lasted all of 4 minutes. And when we needed something from the front desk they responded very promptly. This year we had a slight injury and we ended up at the Celebration Hospital emergency room, and they were fantastic. Staying at Runaway was very comfortable after the injury if we were at a hotel it would have been miserable. We were all back on our feet having a good time in no time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Becoming a Little Run Down”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Homer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort from Nov 1 - Nov 8. This was our second stay at the hotel this year. Our first visit was for a week in Feb. We did notice some changes from our first visit to this visit. Location - the hotel is about 4-5 miles from Disney. Not a big deal for us as we weren't really going to the parks that often. There is a shuttle that can be taken from the Courtyard hotel across the street. It makes 3 trips to Epcot daily and then you would have to take the Disney transport to get around. There is a 24 hour Walmart and 24 hour Target nearby for groceries. There is sufficient dining options in the surrounding area for those who are eating out. Check-in - we arrived at 1am and the desk clerk greeted us warmly and had us on our way in minutes. We had the same clerk when we checked out and thought she was very friendly. Apartment - we had a one bedroom apartment on the second floor. It was approx 700 sq feet. The kitchen had a full stove, fridge, microwave, dishwasher, kettle, coffee maker, dishes, cutlery and pots/pans. It had a pub style dining table that sat 4. We had a sofa and chair in the living area along with a large tv. The bedroom had a queen bed with a dresser, two night tables and a large tv with dvd player. The closet was a walk in closet that also contained a safe that you could use. We managed to lock our laptop in it. The bathroom was off the bedroom. The apartment is beginning to show some wear and tear. It could use a fresh coat of paint and in some areas a full cleaning. We had spider webs and bugs above the front door that the cleaner should pick up on. One day there were leaves on the stairs in the apartment which the cleaner tracked in as they weren't there when we left. Our shower curtain rod was sagging so the shower curtain left a gap near the wall and caused the bathroom floor to get wet. We called to have it fixed and nothing was done with it. The walk-in closet had no hangers in it which makes it almost useless. We did not have a comforter on the bed, only the top sheet and a thin blanket. The frying pan was in need of replacement. The vents needed to be wiped down as they had things growing on them. We did not have these kinds of issues in Feb. We also don't understand why there is the need to clean everything out of the apartment before the next guests arrive. For example, we bought dishwasher soap for the dishwasher and left the rest behind. I am sure that it gets thrown out because no one on this post seems to indicate that there are any of this kinds of items from the previous guests. Everytime someone has to go out and purchase it. Grounds - the grounds are nice. We didn't check out the pool area but my in-laws who stayed in a different apt said they were nice. There is also a gym and workout room for guests to use. Overall, we may stay here again but would check this post to see about the cleanliness issue before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accomodation and location”
Reviews.Author: EnglandDrew
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 week stay and must say that the accomodation and location of the apartments exceeded our expectations. We had a first floor apartment whcih we found to be huge, very clean and comfortable and had all the facilities that we required. On booking in we found the reception staff very helpful and polite. The landscaping and pool complexes were very impressive and we would recommend the apartments to anyone and we will certainly be returning here in a couple of years time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: smjr1
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed her for a long weekend this past October when we were visiting Disney. It was only about 10 minutes away from Disney. The area was nice. The pool area and deck were very nice for families. The pool towels were quite small so you may want to bring your own. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with 4 of us and it was plenty big enough. We requested a second floor suite because of noise, however, there was none to worry about, very quite. The second floor rooms have no balcony though, the first floor have small patios. The rooms were quite large compared to Disney resort rooms but they are older so they were a little worn down. The kitchen was nice with all major appliances. There was no frying pan so we went to Walmart and just bought one. The Walmart is within walking distance, along with many resturants and shopping centers just down the road. The wireless internet was not working that well. I do not know if this is normal, but there is a computer for everyone in the lobby. The internet was not working at all the day we needed to print our boarding passes, so the receptionist printed them for us on their computers. We had to ask for extra towels, so they gave us enough for the weekend. You may want to bring your own dish soap and laundry detergent, if you do not want to buy it at the front desk. Overall, we highly enjoyed our stay and are planning another trip down at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of paradise on earth!”
Reviews.Author: travelchic29
Reviews.Content: Well alright! Perhaps the title is a bit of an exaggeration, but as far as my personal experience during the time I stayed here at the Mike Ditka Resorts - Runaway Beach Club; I have to say it was more than I expected. We were a family of five, with two teenagers and one child age 5. We had the 2 bedroom 2 bath suite and it was comfortable for everyone. I doubt that we would have felt the same way, if we would have stayed at a regular boring hotel. It felt like being at home, at least to us. We relaxed while enjoying the scenery and at the same time dipped into the south beach pool. My Daughter enjoyed the key west pool specifically for kids and so did the teenagers. :-) Very nice and tranquil with Island music playing around the pool area. Not crowded at all and the staff was friendly. The Villas are nice looking and I had some time to take a few pictures of the area. I had no problems and everything seem to go very well during my stay there. The location is great! Lots of attraction and shops nearby, very close to Disney's Typhoon Lagoon park, which is where we ended up going. We stopped by a nearby grocery store and cooked breakfast, lunch, and dinner. That helped us save money v.s. going out to eat. We had everything we needed at our reach and we left home with clean clothes as I did lite laundry. Now, I know that there is a $10 fee that the resort charges every night that you stay there and that seems to be the most common complain I hear from folks. If this is something you are not willing to pay, then look elsewhere, otherwise, I think it's worth it. My advise to any traveler is: " Always check hidden fees while reading the fine print before booking anyplace and before it's too late to make any changes. If anything, do some research. " That should help. As far as complaints about how this place is mediocre--although everyone is entitled to their own opinions; my opinion is that in some instances there will be times when we all have our good days and our bad days, this happens to all of us at some point; also everyone has their own likes and dislikes. In closing--I would highly recommend this resort to anyone; especially, if you have a family. My husband fell in love with the place and we left nothing, but good memories behind. We shall return, that's a fact! :-)

Reviews.Title: “So many better places in the area”
Reviews.Author: smack25
Reviews.Content: No way this place should be ranked 3.5 stars. The place is just filthy and the customer service personel at the front desk were simply rude. No where to eat within1/2 mile. Cops were in building when my wife and I went to check in investigating a missing wallet from one of the rooms. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of space at the right price”
Reviews.Author: weegl
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 recently had a nice long weekend in the Disney area. This time we selected the Mike Ditka Runaway Beach. We choose the destination for 2 primary reasons: 1. It offered plenty of space for us to spread out (we got a 1 bedroom that had 2 pull out sofas in the living area); and, 2. the summer rate was reduced to under $100 a night, which put us right in our "sweet spot" when getting lodging in Orlando. The complex is a series of two story "houses" that have units configured into a variety of sizes. Each unit has at least one full bathroom, full laundry room and fully equipped kitchen. The clubhouse and pool were a short walk away from any of the buildings. You can park right at your building, so that is a plus for us. There was a huge walmat within walking distance, so we were able to get breakfast and lunch stuff without much effort. It was clean and convenient to the Disney area, so it pretty much met our expectations. I was a little disappointed that there was an additional $10/night "resort fee", since it only included gym access and wireless internet. A bit excessive in my mind. The only drawback we experienced was that the walls are a bit thin, and you can hear your neighbors upstairs moving around quite a bit. We liked it alot overall and would return again if the right rate came up. There are more luxurious condo-like accomodations in the area, but it can get expensive and you might have to do a "tour" of the property to get a good rate. You won't have that problem here as it is actually not a timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it, skip it.....”
Reviews.Author: palmdiver
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only 1 night (fortunately) and were very disappointed. We use trip advisor quite often and the rankings are usually pretty spot on, but not this time. How in the world is this resort ranking so high? There is not much to do with kids at this place and restaurants are a good drive away. They have 2 pools that were overcrowded and small. The room was "freezing" and did not have a control to easily change it. The room also showed lost of wear and tear and was not very clean as we found dried food throughout the condo. 2 beds? What a joke. The pullout sofa in the family room was the most uncomfortable bed imaginable with a bar running right through the middle and the thinnest mattress available on the planet. If you have kids do not subject them to this torture. Families are best advised to book one of several other hotels in Orlando that are 1. cheaper 2. have better pools for the kids to enjoy at night. 3. Have restaraunts/bars close by and 4. Have plenty of kids running around for your kids to socialize with. This resort was a joke, will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected/ you dont get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: TMurrayRaleigh
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the scheduled check-in time which was 3:00 pm on Thursday June 26, 2008. We were told that the room that we were orginally assigned wasnt ready and we would be put into another room. We went to our room which appeared to be clean but to my shock and dismay it wasnt. The bathroom had a toilet seat that should have been changed years ago, it has cracks on the entire seat so if you dare sit on it I would be concerned with being infected with something. The room was hot and we attempted to adjusted the cooling setting but to no avail, we had to call the front desk and they sent a maintenance man to unlock the thermostate and his comment to us was "you want it lower than 75 degree". He proceeded to unlock it and left. I went to the restroom and found that the glasses has resedue of toothpaste from the following tenants, I alerted the front desk and they sent the housekeeper back to see if I wanted clean glasses. I declined. We wanted to take a nap so I pulled the covers back only to find several hairs from the previous tenant there I walked to the front desk and let them know that If they would give me the sheets I would change the sheets myself but they said they would send a housekeeper. The housekeeper came and said that she would send sheets by someone. Because of the sheet incident in the main room I became suspicious and checked the sleeper sofa only to find filty sheets on the pullout. There is only one remote control for both tv's. I guess I expected more of a place that has such good reviews or maybe I wanted to just get my money's worth. I suggest that if anyone wanted to stay here upon arrival check you sheets and glasses. It is such a disappointment!!!!!!!! This place compares to the motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: DaSilva255
Reviews.Content: I personally loved it when we stayed at Mike Ditka Resorts Runaway Beach Club. I own a timeshare down in the Cape. We happened to stay at the Runaway Beach Club because of a bad experience at a resort that I booked with our timeshare. We left in the middle of our vacation and stayed at the Runaway Beach Club I loved it. The unit was clean, very close to attractions, updated units, the only thing that i wished they had was a pool side bar or a resturant on site.Other then that everything was great .

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: IlliniFan06
Reviews.Content: I recently went down to Disney to enjoy a weekend with three of my friends. After looking at several hotels on travel websites, we decided on Mike Ditka's Runaway Beach Club because we got a great deal (two bedroom loft for $149 a night!) and it seemed to be pretty close to the attractions, shopping and nightlife areas that we were interested in. Let me say we absolutely made the right decision! This place was fantastic! It was literally minutes from Disney World and there was a Super WalMart right around the corner to get groceries and everything else we'd forgotten. We didn't have any problems with the staff, in fact they were extremely helpful in all the encounters we had with them. Every night when we came back we saw the security driving around the grounds and we had to use a key card to get into the gate. We didn't use the business center at all since we were there solely for pleasure, so I can't comment on that. We did, however, enjoy the pools and hot tubs and they were very relaxing. It was nice that there is a seperate kids pool so we had some quiet time in the "adult" pool. The room itself was wonderfully decorated in a Carribean theme with high ceilings, fans, and art. The kitchen was fully-stocked with all cutlery, dishes, cups, diswashing detergent and coffee. Plus there was laundry detergent so we could wash our clothes after spending a day in the parks. Beds were very comfortable, even the fold out couch in the loft was great. The loft option is the best way to go as it can serve as another bedroom and there's a tv, air hockey and foosball table, and Playstation hook-up up there (get it from the front desk I believe) which would keep kids occupied on the down time. I'd read other reviews where it said that you often heard noises from the other villas, we didn't hear anything during our 5 night stay but perhaps that was because we were always coming in late. Note - this place seems more like a condo than a hotel. We didn't get full cleaning and turn-down service every day, just a quick pick up. We requested more towels when we needed them, but they came right away. So it appears you need to ask if you need anything additional. Overall, fantastic place and truly felt like a home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: stadyl77
Reviews.Content: Eight of us recently stayed 7 nights in a 3 bedroom 2 bath condo at this resort. It was truly amazing! It was very clean & very nicely decorated! The beds were super comfortable! Our master bath had a king size bed with a pillow top mattress on it. We had a garden tub/shower in our bathroom & a huge walk in closet with a safe! The bath towels were big & fluffy! The resort was centrally located near all the parks & attractions, right off Osceola Parkway! We were only 10 minutes to Disney Parks, 15 minutes to Gatorland, etc. It was close to several restaurants (Joe's Crab Shack, Chili's, Denny's, etc.) There is a Super Wal Mart literally just around the corner from the resort, which we visited several times. The fully furnished kitchen was handy & saved us some money from eating out so much! It was fully furnished with all cooking utensils, pots, pans, plates, silverware, tupperware, you name it! There was a dishwasher, a washer & a dryer in our condo. Each bedroom had it's own big tv with cable. The living room also had a pretty good sized tv & also had a dvd player, which my kids loved. The only concern I had was that the day before we left, the maid didn't bring us any clean towels & didn't come get our trash. The trash can in the kitchen was pretty small & the trash filled up rather quick. I had to do a load of towels for us to use the next day, but I didn't mind that much. After all, we had a washer & dryer right there. I didn't feel the need to call the front desk & complain. Another thing is, you have to pay a $10/day room fee up front when you check in. Both pools were very nice. The kids pool has zero depth entry, which was nice with my 2 year old son. The view from the pool was very pretty. It overlooks this big pond with a pretty fountain in the middle of it. They show a kids movie out by the pool a couple of nights a week. They also have several daytime kids activities planned on weekdays. I would definately recommend this resort! It was great! I'm all ready to go back & we've only been home 5 days now!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: AustinLola
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through southwest airlines and paid $79 a night. It made me very nervous because to me that was cheap. I had my husband our two kids and grandma and it was great. The grounds were beautiful and the staff was great. Very friendly through the whole stay. I did call ahead and request to be by the lagoon and pool area because of all the comments about the thin walls. There were nights when we heard plenty of banging around from upstairs so be careful of the noise factor. Otherwise it was great and the kids loved it. Nice big rooms with a great kitchen area and the pool area is great.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious villa, good location, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: smileeface
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3bedroom/2bath St. John villa the weekend of May 16, 2008. We had 6 girls ages 12 & 16 to celebrate our daughters' birthdays. This was the perfect place to stay for our large group without spending a fortune. Very roomy! With that many girls running around, doing each other's hair, swapping clothes, thank goodness for the space! I never felt frazzled because I was comfortable, and so were they. The 2 long couches in the living room are a great idea. The vanity areas (double sinks) in both baths are convenient. The kitchen is very well stocked, plenty of plates and glasses. I followed someone's advice and brought dishwasher detergent, dish soap & sponge & laundry detergent. They do not provide even a sample of these items, which would be very disconcerting if you were not aware of in advance. As stated there is a Super Walmart 24 hrs very close by. To my knowledge they do not provide disney transportation, althought I'm not absolutely certain of this. We drove there from Ft. Lauderdale, so we had our car. This is located right off I-535 sandwiched between Lake Buena Vista and Kissimmee. It's about a 10 min drive to downtown Disney & the waterparks, maybe 15-20 mins to the Disney theme parks. Good, safe location. Decent pool area with nightly outdoor movies, one indoor basketball court, gym/work-out room. Villas look freshly painted outside. Beachy, "Key West" style decor, comfortable beds, decent towels, good a/c, good closet space. Our unit had 2 lightbulbs out in the master bathroom and two paddles were broken off the ceiling fan in one of the bedrooms (unusual). I only notified them of this once we checked out though, but even with that, the apartment was clean, well-kept, well stocked, and pretty as a whole. We vacation in Orlando a few times each year, so many times I can't count. We have stayed in all caliber of hotels & resorts. This was a great stay for the price. FYI: AAA offered a better rate than the resort website. We were all very happy with the stay and would return and recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Runaway Beach Club!!”
Reviews.Author: CappaccinoGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took my sister to Disney World and I did a lot of research on places to stay offsite. Mike Ditka's RBC resort was perfect. The room was spacious and the setting was very relaxing. We booked a combo flight/hotel via Expedia to get the a good deal on a 1 bedroom. The staff was professional and prompt when we asked for an additional blanket. A huge benefit to this resort is the location. As mentioned in previous posts, RBC is located next to a Super Walmart. Aditionally, it only took us 10-15 minutes to drive to Walt Disney World (we left around 8:30am and took Hwy 192 to avoid toll highways). All in all, an excellent bargain for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! Don't listen to negative reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: satisfiedcustomer51
Reviews.Content: This is a GREAT place to stay. It is so much larger and nicer than a hotel room. Our room was recently redone. It had a beautiful kitchen, granite countertops, full-size appliances including a refrigerator, dishwasher, etc. and cute beach paintings and other accessories that made it feel "homey". The master bedroom had it's own bathroom with a great shower/tub and a HUGE walk-in closet and a TV. The other bedroom had a HUGE walk in closet too, and a TV also. There was another TV in the main room. We stayed in a 2-br/2br condo. Another especially important thing, the hot water tank didn't run out!!!! We took consecutive, hot showers and it was always warm. There is a pretty lake and it's just a short, scenic walk to the pools. One pool has a kid play area that my kids loved. There is also a hot tub and a beautiful deck. There was a nice gym and workout area, too.It was also very, very quiet. We never heard our neighbors once. It was also very clean. My family and I loved this place and would definitely stay here again!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: PaluetteandJoe
Reviews.Content: This Resort was the best! We've stayed at other Resorts in the Orlando area in past years but this one has our vote. It was CLEAN,QUIET,SPACIOUS, We just loved it And we recommend it to everyone Thanks for the wonderful week!!!! The only thing we would like to see added are grills so we can cook out some evenings!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay, Great rates, Why stay in a room when you can have a home.”
Reviews.Author: spankypsl
Reviews.Content: A Great stay...... We booked our 2 night stay for a fast weekend getaway to Disney. Let me start off by saying we are not " tourist" My family and I live in S. Florida and have been annual Pass holders to Disney as well as Universal for years. We have stayed from anywhere from a night to a week in the Orlando area and I can not believe we have never come across Mile Ditka Resort before now, I really do not understand the negative reviews the resort as received. We booked the 2 bedroom w/loft and I must say was very impressed! Very large,clean,up to date decor. For what we paid for this ( I booked Expedia) you could not have stayed at a motel six in the Orlando area) I am a very picky person and love to be pampered but if you want a great family place with room to spare this is it. I do have to say the pools are average, but they do have nice indoor basketball court as well as a great weight room ( husband & boys were impressed) The only thing I could see this resort could improve upon is on replenishing the kitchen & bath supplies . One note.... remember to bring your own laundry & dish soap as well as a kitchen sponge or dish cloth, they do supply dishwasher detergent. If you are coming to the Orlando area this is a GREAT place to stay ( 3 miles to Disney). If anyone has any questions on this resort or the area in general please don't hesitate to email me. spankypsl@aol.com. ENJOY YOUR FAMILY & HAVE FUN!! Will post pics.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your belongings!”
Reviews.Author: Disneylover_8
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 suites May 11-18th 2008. It would have been an excellent stay, but we have two complaints. 1. Maid service stole my jacket and my youngest daughters'. The resort has not offered to replace them. I left our jackets on the chair in the master bedroom. I did not use them since it was 90 degrees all week, so I'd bet my life that I never took them out of the room like the hotel suggested I must have done.
