The hotel apologized but I'm out at least $200 for replacing the jackets. (Even though I spent over a grand with them). The 2nd complaint is that we could hear the upstairs neighbor children running back & forth and crying all night when trying to sleep. Noisy! The downstairs neighbors partied outside and I could hear their entire conversations through my bedroom window. As entertaining as it was, I would have rather gotten a longer good nights rest. Other than that, it was a nice place. I will not return though, I'm kinda fond of my personal belongings and want to stay some-where where I will feel safer. If you do stay here, Lock up all your clothes, esp your jackets!

Reviews.Title: “A very mediocre experience...”
Reviews.Author: naport44
Reviews.Content: Our stay started with the air conditioning not working very well, and first night we turned down sheets and there was blood on them. Once getting clean sheets, and the airconditioning fixed the rooms themselves though getting a little beat up could be really nice for a large party. The maid service is far from stellar, but I guess you get what you paid for. The pools are nice, and the location is great if visiting Disney parks or need to grab a quick bite to eat. If this hotel just had a quick renovation it would be a great deal...but until that happens I expect the reviews to continue to get more and more negative.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but there is better our there”
Reviews.Author: northcarolinatravler
Reviews.Content: This is a nice place to stay. Not the greatest, but a nice place for a getaway. It is like a villa of homes, and the one I stayed in was a 3 bedroom with 2 baths, kitchen, den and laundry room. The master bed squeeked all night long and finally we had to put pillows behind the headboard to make it stop squeeking. The blinds in the windows were thin and you woke up as soon as the sun came out. It was clean but could have been spruced up with some paint. The furniture was starting to show some ware. All the bedrooms had a tv and the den has a tv. This place has 2 pools, a hot tub, a nice deck. There is a computer in the lobby but it cost $2.95 for 15 minutes of use. There is a gym and a indoor basketball court. Before you come to Orlando you may want to think about going else where. Universal was just okay. Islands of Adventures got on my nerves and was glad to leave. Epcot was very nice. There were no lines anywhere we went and we got right on at all the rides. I would hate to go there in the summer when it is crowded, it would be a miserable place to go. I think you can find better places to go for vacation such as, Las Vegas, Nigara Falls, and if you want a great theme park consider Dollywood in Tennessee , it is so much better than Disney and Universal. International Drive is a dump. The resturants are showing there age and it is kind of dirty. We ate breakfast at the $3.99 Ponderosa Buffet and it had Pork and Beans on the breakfast buffet. Who ever heard of such. I would give Orlando a 3 on a scale of 1 to 10 with 10 being great. All the outlet malls there have the same old stuff. I have no reason to ever want to go back there. If you like lines, and parks that get on your nerves, and dirty resutrants and worn out hotels then this is the city for you. You would love it.

Reviews.Title: “By far an EXCELLECT stay!”
Reviews.Author: RudyDoc
Reviews.Content: I am just now getting around to writing this review. I feel I wouldn't be giving this resort it's proper due if I didn't. My family (wife and 3 children) stayed here last October on our trip to Florida. It was excellent! The room we had was nothing short of a decent sized apartment. Two large bedrooms and 3 big wscreen TVs. We were in very close proximity to Disney parks and Walmart. We went to Walmart and purchased groceries for our stay and to take into Disney. By the way, we went to MGM on our first day, and there was no way we could have left for lunch and returned later to see everything. I do not know how people can say they do this! The way the show times are set up, you would definitely miss something by leaving. It takes time to get to your car, drive back to the resort (even though you are close) eat, and then return. No way! We ended purchasing a cooler from Walmart the next day and took food into Disney World and thatorked out perfect! Back to the resort. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous and we were most pleased. We are planning another trip in the fall and we will definitely be returning to Runaway Bay!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Comfortable & Well Placed”
Reviews.Author: AllGreen
Reviews.Content: We spent a very pleasent two weeks in Runaway Beach, after booking through Expedia on a flight/hotel package. The resort is fairly new and benefits from being relatively small compared to many similar resorts around the WDW/LBV area. It's extremely well situated, close to all the Disney parks and shopping areas, with a Super WalMart almost on it's doorstep. I had phoned the resort before travelling and requested an apartment close to the pool and that's exactly what we were given. We had an upstairs "loft" apartment, one bed/bath, with a well supplied kitchen. The only slight drawback was the stairs up to the apartment - although they didn't trouble us, they could possibly be a problem for some. Service was good, with a maid coming in daily to make the beds, remove trash etc, although you will be asked for a $10 per day charge to cover this (something Expedia failed to mention!). Checking in/out was painless and PC access is provided free to check in for your flight back (there is a charge to access the internet on this PC, but not for flights and wireless connectivity is free across the site). The pool area is excellent - it was never over-crowded when we were there and the children's pool was very popular with the kids. Parking was more than adequate and the grounds were never less than immaculate. All told, this is a good place to stay if you are not looking for a great deal of on-site activity - it's not a resort that provides a bar/restaurant/entertainment, but it does provide a good standard of accomodation at a very reasonable price. I would be happy to stay there again (especially as I was offered a 15% discount!), even though I did miss some of the on-site activities a resort like Sheraton's Vistana provides. However, it would be unfair to directly compare this resort with others of a far greater size. It's quiet, clean, comfortable and well run & and it's convenient location makes it well worth consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: deeandray
Reviews.Content: Stayed here several times for volleyball tournaments. Clean, accomodating and friendly staff. Just recently I had to cancel at the last moment due to a family medical emergency and they were so kind.... they refunded my deposit and wished me luck with my family situation. I was so impressed and grateful. I wasn't even going to ask since it was so late but, they said not to worry and wished me well...nice to know there are businesses out there that take the human approach...thanks Runaway Beach..your the best....we will be back to visit soon!! A very grateful customer!

Reviews.Title: “We all loved this place”
Reviews.Author: InAShoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the one bedroom with king bed which ended up having two pull out couches in the livingroom and the kids all enjoyed the novelty of sleeping together like that. I did request a room on the lagoon side as other reviewers complained of the highway running along the backside of some of the outer ring buildings. We could hear people walking upstairs at times, but I think they went to bed before us and got up after us, so that was not a problem. The unit was so roomy, we did use the washer & dryer a few times, didn't see any bugs in our first floor unit & the trash was removed everyday. Went to the nearby Walmart and bought groceries for breakfast, lunch & snacks. It was an easy drive to the Disney parks. The kids loved both pools. No problems at check in or check out. I would definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value at Runaway”
Reviews.Author: MarianToronto
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week stay at Runaway in Orlando (Apr 26th to May 2nd). We had an upper level 2 bedroom condo and were very happy with it. We did a ton of research before booking this place and chose Runaway because of the mainly positive reviews and we really liked the photos that were posted. We were not disappointed. We arrived at Runaway around noon and were allowed to check in early which was great. Our unit was clean, bright and quiet. The rooms were very large, the beds comfy. My two kids shared a room which was perfect. We even had a safe in the master bedroom closet so we left some valuables in there. Some postings indicated that there was no daily housecleaning but our unit was cleaned daily to my surprise. If you stay in a condo type accomodation and are going to do any cooking/washing (especially with kids), I'd suggest bringing (or buying) the following: detergent for the dishwasher, laundry detergent, a small bottle of dishwashing liquid, coffee filters (number 2 basket) and dishtowels. Room for improvement? Sure. The music that plays at the pool should be turned off at 11PM or so. It went on all night. I think that they should leave some of the basics (like dish detergent) in the units because guests like us must constantly leave these things behind. Also, remote controls for the TVs in the two bedrooms would have been nice. Other than that, if you have a car, this is a great place to stay. All the theme parks are within a (maximum) 20-30 minute drive. Walmart is close as are the Buena Vista and Premium factory outlets. We thought that we got great value. Two bedroom condo for roughly the same price as a nice hotel room. I even got a coupon for a 15% discount for our next visit. If we go back to Orlando, I'd definitely re-rent at Runaway again.

Reviews.Title: “BE CAREFUL AT THIS PLACE!!!”
Reviews.Author: librarylady1
Reviews.Content: The condo was nice. Unfortunately, the cleaning crew wasn't. The Monday after Easter one of the cleaning crew stole my three diamond wedding ring from my make-up case that had been tucked away in a drawer of the bathroom vanity. When we returned from spreading my son-in-laws ashes, we found that the rooms had not been cleaned, the beds were unmade and the garbage still sitting in the kitchen. We didn't discover this until we returned home. After numerous calls that were not returned, we had to resort to pretending we wanted to book a stay. This is the only way we could get someone to call us back. That was a waste of time as they denied everything, thus becoming a part of the theft ring. IF you stay there, don't take anything of value. If your fingers swell like mine did, DO NOT remove your rings unless you can lock them in your car or keep them in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for all the theme parks”
Reviews.Author: ollymae
Reviews.Content: We are a family with 3 children and booked this accomodation as it stated that it was close to Disney on the website. We were not disppointed. The hotel is made up of lots of detached 2 storey apartments. We were allocated a ground floor 2 bedroom condo which had a view of the lake from the front windows, which was pleasant. There was a huge bed in the master bedroom, and a large double and a single bed in the second bedroom. We also had a laundry cupboard washing machine & tumble dryer, which I found very useful for keeping up with the washing. The cleaner came every day and made the beds, cleaned bathrooms and emptied bins, which was a great help. Staff were very helpful and the maintenance man came within the hour when we had a problem. The 2 pools were very nice and the kids spent most of their time there when we were not at the Theme parks, which were less than 15 minutes drive away. If you want have a quiet place away from the humdrum and with easy access to the parks, providing you have a car. This is an ideal location. There also loads of great resaurants in within a 5-10 minute drive. I would definately book it again and recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping unaccountable”
Reviews.Author: engineer1234
Reviews.Content: Housekeeping is not accountable to the front desk at all, and appears to do whatever they want to do. Warning to would be travellers to this hotel - don't leave valuables in your room at this place. Unfortunately, my wife and son left their only jackets for the trip in the bedroom closet after check-out. We remembered they were there and went back only 2 hours later to pick them up and the jackets were missing and the room was made up!! The next three days, my wife and I left 3 messages with housekeeping to return calls, and to front-desk to check with housekeeping again and then to return calls. Calls never returned at all by anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A great place for a great price”
Reviews.Author: msat
Reviews.Content: My family was there all last week for 7 nights. We were very pleased w/our accommodations. We had a 3 bedroom unit located across the lake & to the left of the pool/office area. Fortunately our unit was on a top floor & inside one of the courtyards so any outside or neighbor noise was at a minimal. We were traveling w/two 17 yr old boys & one college age male & they enjoyed the basketball court & weight room in the evenings. We liked the fact that it wasn't in a high rise w/elevators to deal with & very easy to park practically at your door. If you have an outside floor unit you can park at your door. The location is convenient to all parks & activities. Having a Super Walmart w/in walking distance was also handy. The maid service is limited unless you want to pay extra for more thourogh cleaning. I was expecting only towel & trash service & was suprised they even made the beds. The maids did seem a bit confused on what items to leave. Some days no washclothes, the next day an over abundance. Another day no hand towels. There were cobwebs up in the cathedral ceilings. If you are sensitive to security lights or early morning sunlight you may want to hang a blanket on the window as I did. The faux wooden blinds do very little to block light. We are planning to stay here again our next trip to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I excpected!”
Reviews.Author: Travelalot07
Reviews.Content: The staff was great, but my overall stay was less than expected. Upon arrival I had to have the floors cleaned. We were also in a room that had been stained by a leak somewhere on the roof. I had to clean the tables because their was still food left from the guest before us. We love to travel and expect our rooms to be clean upon arrival. We were very dissappointed. If you can, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: uruguay2
Reviews.Content: It wasn't bad. I do agree with previous postings about the walls being paper thin. I could hear everything going on on the unit above us. They had no 2nd floor units available, otherwise I'd ask for that one. I didn't get traffic noise because I was on the lake side, so that was good. It was clean, but if they choose white comforters they need to make sure they are stain free. They had a couple of stains! I was happy though on the cleanliness. I can't complain about the bathrooms, actually they were spic and span. We went with 3 teenagers and it was perfect for them. The 2 bedroom suite had enough space for them and us. OVerall I do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Large and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: celticgreat
Reviews.Content: We were in between resorts and scheduled a one-night stay at MDR Runaway Beach Club. We booked a two-bedroom with two beds in one of them for the kids. The suite we were placed in was on the lake side, back side of the building. There seems to be at least 3 suites and probably 4 per unit (we were only there one night and I didn't notice). We arrived early and were hoping to get checked in early, but that did not happen. You can't really expect this so I don't hold it against them, The person at the counter offered to let us change and use the facilities which was nice of him. The kids were able to use the pool and the basketball court while we waited for our suite. We couldn't check in until slightly after 4 PM. Upon checking into our place we found it to be very large for a 2BR place, with ample closets and room for plenty. Our unit was clean and we had no issues with it. I believe you could plan an extended stay here as it is that large. I did hear upstairs neighbors some as they ran up and down the stairs but they did not bother us for too long. I heard no highway noise. The grounds and the facilities were very nice, two pools, not that large but sufficient, adequate seating with perhaps a need for more loungers. This worked out nicely for us and I would recommend the place to others.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: kenmore
Reviews.Content: Wow-stayed with the wife and 2 kids here last week and cannot believe how my experience was so different than 90% of these reviews--I travel frequently and know things are never perfect. But-there are 8 units on the backside of the resort next to a major highway and the traffic noise was ridiculous-avoid these units. The unit itself was not clean--food/coffee stains in kitchen--hair on bathroom floor with mold in tub caulking/curtain--hair and stain on room comforters and the worst problem was the paper thin celing--if you are a light sleeper, better have an upstairs room or you'll be up all night like us if you have loud guests nearby. I believe your experience will totally depend on where you are located in the complex and if you are near the lake maybe it will be more positive. We were so tired this was a trip buster for us--a total waste of time and money..Management blew us off stating they were too full the move us, Never again. We'll go back to Portofino at Universal again next time.

Reviews.Title: “An awful lot of bang for your buck!”
Reviews.Author: lorinhl
Reviews.Content: I was leary of it being all a bit too good to be true, but it was the perfect location for our family. Hotel staff was OK, not super, but the room was clean (few cobwebs and dusty overhead fans but such high ceilings I can forgive it!) and very spacious. We were traveling with our kids 18 and 9 so having space to chill out separately was very nice. I did a load of laundry almost daily, and went home with no piles to contend with. Very close to Disney and every restaurant and convenience could not be closer. Pool was nice, I could do without the music all the time as it's peaceful to read and just sit and soak up the sun--but today everyone wants noise all the time. The kitchen was very manageable and it was nice to have breakfast in. We had fresh baked cookies out of our oven every evening (got a roll of dough from Target nearby). Our coffee maker was broken but they replaced it almost immediately. I will say that between the large security lights and the early morning sun they should invest in black out shades for the bedrooms, needed my sleep mask for sure! Two big baths, great storage and a TV in every room too! I would stay again! As close to perfect as you can get and a very reasonable price! We paid about $160 per night for a 3 bedroom 2 bath upper. The stairs are a killer so if you have any issues with that get a lower. I can see where it could be noisy but our neighbors were fine. The outside noise did wake us one morning as people were leaving etc, but I wouldn't say it was a huge issue. Stay away from the pool if you need quiet like we do. The decor was nice and tropical, they did need to do some paint touch ups, but over all we highly recommend! When you consider how expensive and underwhelming the Disney properties are, it was well worth driving 10 minutes to get to the park and nice to be away from it all at the end of the day. My whole family rates this 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and new, but beware of traffic noise in outer units!”
Reviews.Author: kdcminmd
Reviews.Content: We were taking a family trip to Disney. Our two kids are 11 and 7. They LOVED the 3bdr Loft unit. My son slept in the loft and my daughter had a bedroom to herself. So that was great, we were not on top of each other. Everything was brand new and clean. It is furnished in a pretty beach motif, with white louvered furniture. The kitchen was new with granite countertops. The only problem and it was big, was our first unit backed up to the main road right behind the hotel. THE NOISE WAS AWFUL! We could not sleep at all. So the next day we got moved to an interior unit that lined the lagoon. GORGEOUS! It was so peaceful and pretty. We could not hear the road noise at all. So definitely stay away from the buildings in the outer ring and go for an inner unit. (I want to say it was units 14-18 that were on the road, but check that out first.) The only other complaint I had was housekeeping apparently keeps their supplies for each unit in the garage. In one day they must have opened the door 6 times. I was sick in bed that day right above the garage and it was very disruptive. Finally I had to yell out the window to tell him to stop going in and out. He was very apologetic and had no way of knowing I was up there, so that was not a big deal. But if you have a baby that is trying to nap it could be an issue. Other than the traffic, we thought it was a great place. We have stayed in many disney area condo units and this was definitely one of the best. There is a super walmart right around the corner so you can get groceries, wine, sunscreen, everything you need there. The other negative I can think of is that there is no onsite restaurant or snack bar to grab a bite while at the pool. The pool was nice, and adequate, but not knock your socks off great. Near this hotel is the best seafood restaurant in the area called Landry's. Be sure to stop there for a fancy yet reasonably priced meal. Like all Disney area restaurants, you don't have to be dressed up to eat there and it is kid friendly. We really enjoyed this hotel and would definitely stay there again. Being that it is brand new they might have some kinks to work out in the management area, but we thought it was great. It was not like the Vistana where some units are beautiful and others are stuck in 1980's avocado decor hell.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the PAPER THIN walls!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: inmatom
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 12 year old daughter stayed for 3 nights in March 2008 and had two great nights and one bad night because of noisy neighbors. The condo location and facitlites are top rate. Condos are spacious and have laundry facilities in each unit, basketball gym, workout room, pool, spa,..everything you can think of EXCEPT insulated walls! If you are unfortunate enough like we were and happen to be on the first floor with noisy neighbors above you, you will hear EVERYTHING -- not only their footsteps, but their voices (clearly) their phone, their TV. The condos have paper thin walls and are poorly insulated. Furthermore the staircase to the second floor condos runs through the first floor units -- it's the closet in between the master bedroom and the living room. So, all the noises seem to be amplified through the walls of the first floor condos. The noise was unbearable and after complaining twice to no avail we just had to put up with it during our last night when the families with young kids arrived to stay directly above us. If you don't like hearing thunderous footsteps above you, request the SECOND floor! P.S. There is a $10 per day "facilities charge" in addition to your booking rate.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, and valuable!”
Reviews.Author: Margo113
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful way to vacation! This resort is 5 mins to the Disney entrance...very convenient and proximal to everything a visitor could want -theme parks, shopping, and restaurants. The property itself is beautiful! It seems more like a residence than it does a hotel. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa for about $140 a night. Each room had it's own bathroom and walk in closest. Couple this with a large living room, granite kitchen, and washer/dryer, and you have a vacation filled with relaxation. Tons of room and tons of convenience! It was so nice to go to the Walmart (50 feet away) and buy food so we could stay in and relax versus having to go out to eat for every meal! This was a first for our family and we loved it! If you are not afraid of driving, and think you would enjoy the convenience of what this place has to offer, you will be very pleased with this property. We have been to Disney over 20 times, and THIS is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing Resort!”
Reviews.Author: MissEDiva
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out, everything was absoutely above the bar. The front desk workers were friendly and helpful - they actually displayed customer service! The lobby and ground are very well kept and clean. The area was quiet and it's close to social spots (restaurants and Walmart) and fairly close to the Interstate. The extra cost (compared to a hotel) is definitely worth it!!! This was my second stay and I would recommend it to anyone. It truly feels more like home away from home than a hotel/resort.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Was Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Sooz1255
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoyed this top-notch resort! Our condo was beautifully decorated, nice bright colors. Loved the 3 TV's - one in each bedroom and the living room! Our kids (6 & 8) loved the pools! Staff was very accommodating to our needs. Close to major Florida attractions. Will definitely recommend to friends and family! Wish we would have booked a longer stay!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tampa1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a night for my daughters 15 birthday. The hotel was clean and close to oldtown. We booked a 1 bedroom loft , we had 2 adults and 4 teenagers and there was plenty of room for them to have fun and us to relax in our own bedroom. The loft had a pull out and a foosball table and the living room had 2 pull out couches. Icant say enough good things about this resort. Its a first rate hotel that gives you the extra room and only charges 10.00 resort fee. Alot of "condo" hotels charge a cleaning fee of 60 dollars if you stay less than 5 nights so.... this is a great deal for short stays. There is an indoor basketball court and adult pool, fitness room and kids pool. The only thing missing is a volleyball court, but if your going to the parks this isnt important. If you have young children they offer hoola hoop contests and duck races dive in movies in the pool and lots of other activities. Great hotel we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families with young kids!!!”
Reviews.Author: mfhchef
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and we wished we had booked it for longer!! This is an outstanding place for families with young kids. The kitchen is well-equipped for making breakfasts and packing lunches (recommended for theme park goers) and the washer and dryer in our unit really came in handy! We brought our kids bikes and scooters and they happily rode for an hour in the adjacent courtyard to our room! The pools were fantastic, but the exercise room to not live up to expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: NorthCarolinaBechbum
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place! I am one of those people that will not travel b/c I am so afraid of the hotels and if I have too, I bring my own sheets and sanitize the bed and mattress.So, when l had to find a place for our first real vacation with the kids I had to have something that was as close to the comforts of home that I could get. I FOUND IT!! The villas went beyond my expectations and supassed my level of home comfort. They are not your standard hotel were everybody is holed in one room. These villas have sepreate bedrooms, bathrooms, kitchen, eating area, living room, washer and dryer.And not your cheap stuff, state of the art. It was clean, safe, and the pool & recreation areas were great !! The service was also great. We miss the stay here more than any part of our trip! I would recommend this a thousand times over!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: MickkiNewYork
Reviews.Content: I stayed hat Mike Ditks's Runaway Beach club during the spring Break. I had a party of 7 and we stayed in a 2bedroom suite. It was beautiful. The room was spacious with the comforts of home. There was a king size bed in the master room. A full size bed and a single in the second room. In the Livingroom there was two pull-out sofas. Just when I thought that it couldn't be better , there was a washer and drier,dishwasher,stove,oven.microwave,utensils,pots,pans,cups etc. . I could go on and on. The customer service was great. Always greeted with a smile. The location was terrific. Less than three miles from Walt Disney World. There wasn't room service so you could go buy your own groceries . Your not to far from the resturants and shopping area. The pool was very relaxing. If you want to relax from the long day you've had at the parks ,just sit around the pool or try out the heated Jacuzzi. My stay here was very memorable. I be there in two months to enjoy my home away from home again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Visiting Walt Disney World”
Reviews.Author: fluffnfold
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Runaway Beach Club (RBC) in mid-January of 2008 with my extended family. We booked a 2-bedroom, 2-bath unit in the Key West section. As expected, there were two full baths and two large bedrooms. We could have upgraded (free) to a 2-bdr, 2-bath loft suite (which would have had another loft room with a pull-out sofa bed and an air-hockey table), but one of our guests had mobility issues and couldn't climb the necessary stairs. The master had a king size bed, flat-screen TV, huge walk-in closet with electronic safe, and master bath with Jacuzzi tub and separate shower. The second bedroom had a double (full) bed and a twin (single) bed, suitable for three children but really only two adults (I personally find a double bed too small for two adults). This bedroom also had a huge walk-in closet, flat-screen TV, and a bathroom across the hall with a shower/tub combo (so it wasn't part of the room, but instead the main bathroom for the whole unit; if guests were visiting in the living room, they would use this bathroom). The living room/dining room/kitchen combination was a good size. The living room are had two sofas (each may have pulled out to sofa beds, but I didn't check) and another flat-screen TV. There was a large dining table, along with a nice-size kitchen with a breakfast bar (I think there were three or four chairs at the bar, and four chairs at the table). The kitchen was equipped with everything you would need to make meals. All appliances were regular sized. The décor was attractive--lots of blue and white. The lamps were a nice quality--not the standard motel-room type--as were the framed prints/artwork. Small bottles of toiletries are provided (shampoo and lotion), as are all linens. We had our linens changed once during a 3-night stay (so we had new linens at check in, and then they replaced them on our second night). Light housekeeping was provided--trash removal, linen replacement, and on one morning (but not the other), our beds were made. My only complaint about our suite was that it could have been a little cleaner--a shame, really, because this place has everything else in its favor. The first room we checked into still had the previous guests birthday cake remnants on the kitchen counter (granted, the counters were a dark granite pattern, but it was still evident that no one from housekeeping made even a cursory attempt at wiping them down); the carpets also didn't appear thoroughly vacuumed, and we had some tiny ants that other reviewers had complained about. They moved us to another unit that was cleaner, but not perfectly so. It WAS apparent that the sheets had been changed in both rooms, however, which is really the most important factor. There is coffee provided in the hotel lobby. The pool is attractive, with plenty of chairs. There is also an outdoor Jacuzzi. The fitness center is small but adequate. There is a business center with free internet access--I used it each morning and there was never a wait. The property is quite large, and you could be assigned to a building block that is some distance from the pool/office. Buildings 1 and 2 are connected to the office building itself, so the lower numbers are better located, in my opinion. The numbering of the units within each building block is a bit odd, because the doors for the upper units are next to the doors for the lower units, so there will be "100" and "200" series doors next to each other. Once we figured it out, it made perfect sense, but provided a bit of frustration initially. We did have some trouble with the key-card gate needed to access the parking lots after 8:00 pm. The card only seemed to work from OUTSIDE your vehicle. If you tried to insert the card while sitting in the car, it did not work. Sounds strange, but the trick seemed to be getting out of the card before inserting the card--must be some kind of positioning issue. We saw other guests having the same problem, so it wasn't just our own stupidity! With our first-floor unit, there WAS a big issue of noise from above. The sound of every step of the guests above us was magnified at all hours of the day and night (and they didn't have children, so it was just adults walking around normally.) Keep that in mind--I would recommend asking for a second-floor room for this reason. The location is convenient to access Walt Disney World each day. You can enter the Disney property within 5 minutes or so, but just the entrance--then you have to drive a few more minutes to the parks (but the location isn't much farther than some of the Disney value resorts). There was a shuttle provided, but guests of RBC had to cross the street to catch the shuttle at the Country Inn and Suites (Carlson/Radisson). The shuttle departed the hotel at 8:30, 10:30, and 12:30, returning at 6:30, 8:30, and 10:30. Because our time was limited, we chose to drive ourselves. The cost for parking is $11.00 per day, but the convenience and time-savings was worth it to us. The hotel is located near Route 172, so it's quite easy to get to restaurants and souvenir shops. (EVERY chain restaurant imaginable is within a 2-mile drive, but I didn't see many original non-chain restaurants.) There is a 24-hour super Wal-Mart in the other direction from 172, convenient for picking up groceries and sundry items. The hotel is near Celebration (the real-life town that Disney created), which is a beautiful little spot to walk around, shop, see a movie, and eat in an original restaurant. We didn't have time for more than a drive through on this trip, but it was really pretty. All-in-all, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again--just make sure your room is clean. We paid $99 per night for the 2-bedroom unit, and it was great to have the extra space that a condo unit provided over a regular hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home !!!”
Reviews.Author: CANTWAIT2GO074
Reviews.Content: My family stayed 12/01 to 12/09. Two adults and two children. We had a quick and easy check in, no hassels. 2 bed/2bath condo, king size bed in the master suite with a soaking tub, shower and very large walk in closet. There was a in room safe that we were unable to use because my son ( 6 years old going on 35) insisted on knowing the combo and then putting a totally different one causing the safe not to lock. What fun. Maintenace unable to reset so I just kept my personal belongings with me. The second bedroom had a twin and full size bed and extremely large walk in closet. The second bath was large with a shower/tub and one sink. On that Thursday there were ants. Was told bugs are common in FL and we'll spray for you. Killed them but I had to clean up myself. There was light housekeeping for our 9 day/8 night stay; trash removal, beds made and refreshment of towel and washcloths. We went to Walmart to purchase food for breakfast and to make lunches to take to the parks to save on money. Very helpful to buy water and juice boxes for the kids and then freeze overnight to drink at the park. The pool and hot tub were great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place For Large Family”
Reviews.Author: PattyLM
Reviews.Content: My family of 2 adults and 4 children stayed here the first week of January. We stayed in a St. Johns unit. It had 3 bedrooms. It was perfect for our family. There was plenty of space for each person to relax and be comfortable. There were tvs in every bedroom and one in the front room. Our unit showed minor wear and tear. There were scratches on the coffee table in the living room. A headboard on one of the beds came unattached when my son sat on the bed. Some of the bedding had stains on the comforters. The roominess of the unit and the excellent price we got by booking 6 months in advance on the hotel website made those problems not even bother us. The front desk staff were great. They were very friendly and helpful. We needed directions to one of the theme parks and they printed the directions up for us. When we checked into the unit my husband wanted to put something in the room safe, but it was locked. We called the front desk and a maintenance man came over in less the 10 minutes. The pool, hot tub, and spray pool were very nice. The kids loved them. There was always plenty of parking near our unit. The Runaway Beach Club was close enough to the theme parks to be convenient, but far enough away that you felt like you were in a nice quiet place away from the hustle and bustle. We did hear a helicopter nearby everyday. I don't know if it was for tours or what. It was loud enough so you did notice it during the day, but not so loud that it was bothersome. My family would definitely stay here again on future visits to the area. I would, also. recommend this place for anyone with a family of 5 or more. Having 3 bedrooms was wonderful and we paid less then we would have if we had rented 2 rooms at a regular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven for my nine year old daughter and myself!!”
Reviews.Author: BigCatMank
Reviews.Content: WOW!!!! The Mike Ditka Runaway Beach Club was like a dream come true from top to bottom. The front desk welcomed us from the start and continued to do anything possible for us throughout our stay!! The property was spotless and absolutely beautiful. My daughter Kalynn and I could not have chosen a better place to stay. Our Villa was outstanding in all aspects. We jumped on the shuttle bus every morning and were escorted only a few miles away to our Disney Destinations. We felt safe and right at home atmosphere throughout our trip and time we spent at the Runaway Resort.. As a parent their is nothing I can think of that This Resort could possible offer :-) Thank You all !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Vacation Condo”
Reviews.Author: wilmingtonsinger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Runaway Beach Club on Dec. 17-21, 2007 and, despite the good reviews, we were still pleasantly surprised with the condo. Check-in was a breeze with courteous front desk attendants. They told us that there were no 2 bedroom condos available, so they were upgrading us to a 2 bedroom with a loft. The condo was huge (it would sleep 11!) and immaculate with all the comforts of home. For $99 a night, it was THE bargain in the Orlando area. Because we had a full kitchen, we saved a bundle on food by eating breakfast at "home" each day and packing lunches to take to the parks. We had free light housekeeping each day while we were gone. They took out the trash, gave us fresh towels, and changed the sheets one day as per our request. We did not have a single problem from any employee of this resort - they were all so helpful and friendly. Since we were at the parks all day every day, we only went to the pool/hottub one night. It was lovely, however. I cannot stress enough how close to Disney this resort really is. It was about 10 minutes from door to the welcome gate of Disney. We did not try the shuttle service but it was available to Epcot a few times a day. The price of the condo was to go up on the weekend to $239 (Dec. 21, the start of the "high" season at Disney), so we were going to go to check out and go to another hotel. I liked the Runaway so well that I asked the manager if we could extend our stay one more night and keep our $99 rate. He graciously agreed without hesitation. I will definitely stay here again and would recommend this resort very highly!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for any Orlando, FL visitor”
Reviews.Author: dmfourty
Reviews.Content: I'd like to start my review by saying that I travel on business and with family quite a bit. I have never been impressed with a property enough to take the time to visit a website and post my experience...until now!!! This place is awesome. I read a lot of the reviews before booking and decided that for the money this was the place to stay. I was so impressed with the property. My wife, my 6 year old, my mom, and I stayed in the Martique which is a two bedroom, two full-bath with a loft apartment and it was amazing. It would have slept 7 people comfortable and 11 if you wanted to stretch it. The location is great too. 15 minutes from the airport. 10 minutes from Disney. Walking distance to Wal*Mart. Located on a shopping and eatery oriented area. They also provide AAA discounts. In summation, when I return to Disney or if I know anyone going to Orlando, FL, I will definitely be a spokesperson for Runaway Beach Resort because it was great. --From Louisville, KY resident.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough for our stay.”
Reviews.Author: cassray88
Reviews.Content: We read many reviews before booking, majority were positive so we decided to book. we stayed three nights in december. Six people in our group 3 children and 3 adults, we stayed in a two bedroom suite. Very spacious rooms, clean. we did go to the pools one afternoon during a break from the parks they were nice for a break. No problems during our stay only three nights. We didnt spend much time in the rooms. Would recomend to friends to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not so clean”
Reviews.Author: ynottoday
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel based on the reviews. It was disappointing to find a tub with huge patched crack, dirty comforter, hairs on the night stand, toilet was not clean, bed was uncomfortable, linens were stained and dingy. Housekeeping was not good. Did like the kitchen and convenience. The overall facility was well maintained. Have stayed at 2 star hotels that were nicer than this one - especially for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Bad, Dos, and Donts”
Reviews.Author: Suspect_7
Reviews.Content: My wife, parents, two daughters and I stayed at this resort recently on a trip to Walt Disney world. While we did get the room heavily discounted by touring another timeshare on this property, this review only reflects our stay at Runaway Beach Club. However please see the “dos and donts” section of this review if you plan to go the timeshare discount route. This “resort” is nice and fits the 3 star rating accordingly. Guests can enjoy resort amenities like the outdoor heated pool, hot tub, fitness center, and a business center in the reception area. We stayed in a two bedroom suite with 1 king bed, second bedroom with one full bed and one twin bed, separate living room, and kitchen, ceiling fans, full-sized washer & dryer, in-room safe, and covered-private entrance. It seems that one of the sofas folded out into another bed as well. THE GOOD Price! The location is just a few miles from Walt Disney World, restaurants and other attractions. The rooms are nicely decorated and provide ample space. The kitchen seems to have all of the conveniences of home (appliances, dishes, and items for cooking). There is ample parking and the resort is gated at night (access only available with room key). The heated pool was very kid-friendly and gym and work out facility were first class. Once we knew where we were going check-in seemed to be a breeze (see dos and donts). When we discussed some of the issues that we had, the resort offered to move us to a new room but we declined. THE BAD We booked the room through a third party marketing firm so the room wasn’t what they said it would be (don’t get me wrong, the place is nice). There were a few places that were unclean. We did have dirty linens and trash piled up from the cleaning crew in front of our suite. Despite repeated calls and promises it took about 16 hours for them to remove it. Half of the staff at the beach club seemed friendly and the other half acted as if they would rather kill you than deal with you. The staff at the other locations on the Calypso Cay property were incredibly rude and should not be working with tourists. There are no black out shades like most hotels. The property is well lit which causes issues for people who cant sleep in bright rooms. Beware of the extra charges. The resort charges $8 a day for the use of amenities and around $20 a day for a light maid service. DOS Book directly through the resort or a major booking agency like Priceline. Call and let the front desk know if you do not wish to have the extra services. Report all problems to the front desk only. Go directly to the Beach Club to check in and NOT the Calypso Cay guest services desk or the big “pink" building. Go to Wal-Mart down the street for dish soap, detergent, food, and a really good selection of Disney stuff at great prices. DONTS Do not report your problems to the timeshare promo people. They will promise you the world until you don’t buy in. My wife notices that when the shower steamed up, the mirror read “redrum” or murder backwards. She reported this and a few other issues with the bathroom being dirty. We were told that someone would clean it up but no one ever came. We stayed 5 nights. Regardless of what we experienced we would probably stay at the Beach Club again. It is a good value. Next time we will skip the timeshare promo and book directly through Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Runaway Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: IndianaKris
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful. We had a two bedroom and two bath suite for a very good price. It was much cheaper than the Disney property we stayed at the first part of our trip. The buildings are all new. The furniture was new. The condo was decorated in a very cheery manner. There was so much space and even a washing machine and dryer. The grounds were immaculate with two pools, a hot tub, and a gorgeous lake. The staff was very nice. This is probably the best deal anywhere near Disney. They do have a shuttle they share with the Country Inn and Suites across the road. But it only has three outgoings and three incomings all day and only goes to Epcot. But it was nice to know it was an option. The only complaint we had was with drains not draining as fast as they should. But it was not too bad and not even bad enough to ask them to come and fix. We told them about it at check-out. And there was a family above us with young kids and they seemed to be up all hours and running and jumping or something on the floor. But that happens anywhere. And they only bothered us one night. You have to wear little rubber wristbands when using the property. Those did get annoying as the one for our daughter was too big. But that is no big deal. We would definitely return here and recommend it to anyone. It is also in a nice area of town and there is a Walmart nearby and lots of restaurants. IT is about five miles from Disney, so it is very convenient. You won't be disappointed with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Convenient”
Reviews.Author: cferg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights after a cruise and found it to be adequate. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the grounds were clean and well maintained. The unit we had was the bottom line one and I can imagine that there are better units available, but we booked through Hotwire at a low rate so of course you won't get the show unit. That's OK though. My kids were sleeping on a pull out that had zero padding and was basically springs under cloth, I brought to the attention of the front desk staff and within 1 hour they had installed a new mattress for the kids. Pretty impressive! We wished we had time to use the pool because it looked pretty nice and was quite warm unfortunately we were cramming in a lot of sight seeing and shopping in those 2 days. Oh well next time. There is a reason why this place is rated high for the area, go with the masses on this one.

Reviews.Title: “An OK holiday!”
Reviews.Author: dr_nick_riviera
Reviews.Content: We spent 12 days at the Runaway Beach Club, and we went based on the reviews that we saw on here. Arriving in the early evening, we checked in smoothly, and arrived at the condo. There were three of us travelling, and we had requested a cot (crib) for our 18 month old daughter, we asked for this in advance, so we expected it to be there. It wasn't, we had to ring up an external company and order it, this arrived the next day, and resulted in us moving furniture around so we could put a mattress on the floor for her to sleep on. Not ideal on the first night. Throughout the holiday, the service was peppered with let downs and minor hassles. We asked 3 or 4 times for a change of towels and bedding, and were told that they would be sent 'right over', they never turned up, so we spent alot of time washing and drying our own towels and bedding. The same goes for the collection of the cot on our final day, 4 phonecalls in a 2 hour period, after each one we were told 'someone will be there in 5 minutes.' There was one employee who worked in maintenance who was exceptional, I didn't catch his name, but he had a goatee beard, and drove a blue toyota, I know this because he jump started our rental car one morning, nothing was too much trouble for him. The resort is great though, the condo's fab, with loads of space, the pools we're lovely, and the location is ideal for shopping and parks. We would go back again, but only when our daughter is sleeping in a bed!

Reviews.Title: “Nice...especially for large families”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaJane
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again. The condo fit our needs. A family of 5 we were going to have to find 2 hotel rooms because we would be on top of each other if we didn't but this was perfect for us. We had a 2 bedroom condo with 2 full bathrooms and it was plenty big. Very spacious. We could have easily fit more. The pool area was simple but fit our needs. Your not going to find slides...but a nice area for smaller and larger kids...14, 7 and 3 year old all liked it. Much nicer than any hotel room...much nicer than the disney sport, swan, or the average hotel room. If I was buying a condo I would recommend their floor plan but I would be concerned of quality of work...but I wasn't buying one...just enjoying one. Condo was clean. Plenty of towels and toilet paper. I would rate the beds as soft. A few things I would recommend bringing... a small bottle of dish soap and some dishwasher cleaner (those tablets would be perfect) A scrubing sponge, Small baggy of Coffee(with the filters)..they only supply a day or 2. Otherwise buy the rest at Wal-Mart when you get there. We found a vacume in the entry closet downstairs. I found the pictures on this site to be very accurate. Have a great time! Let me know if this was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hate, Hate, Hate”
Reviews.Author: glen76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Oct with 2 kids, staff were awful 1 member ignored me until she had finished her conversation! Left do not disturb sign on door and came in anyway! Cot was broke and instead of replacing it, handyman (who took 2 hours to get to room) just wrapped tape around it! Do not stay here!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place; fair location & brightly lit”
Reviews.Author: Alaxsxaq
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip since I like to take care of my own meals when I travel and hate living out of standard hotel rooms. The staff was very friendly on arrival (less so on departure - but its was 5am when I left). My unit (an apartment with two bedrooms, a living room and kitchen/dining area) was clean and well appointed. My stay was, overall, pleasant. I didn't get to use any of the other facilities of the resort so I have no comment on them. Some issues, however - first, the place is very brightly lit at night and the street lights shine in through the venetian blinds - it was impossible to completely block out the lights; second - they don't provide dish soap and only one pack of detergent for the dishwasher and no laundry soap (other resort accomodations I've used in Orlando supplied all of these in ample quantities); the pots were a bit worn out in my unit with badly scoured anti-stick coating. The location is decent - quiet and safe for sure, but not as convenient to a decent grocery and the Disney facilities as other similar places nearer to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: driver999
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business. Mike's is a great place to stay for an extended period. I brought the family with, plus 2 friends of our kids. Plenty of room. The kids had their area and my wife and I had ours. Great price for the size of the room. It was a home away from home. It was nice to have a kitchen and washer & dryer. We were able to food and snacks at walmart and make small meals in our kitchen. Also, we could leave everything in the room without worry since there is only maid service if you request it. Why stay at the big name hotels and pay for services you won't use. The pool here was excellent and they even had "float in movies". I would have had to pay triple the rate at any other hotel to get the same type of room. Granted, this is probably more for a working class family vs a blueblood family. If you have to work for your money and want a great value, this is the place. I have already booked for my next several business trips in the area. .Awesome place. Awesome Price!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - but be aware how service works”
Reviews.Author: MHEvanston
Reviews.Content: Many posters have mentioned the service. This resort is not actually a hotel - if you carefully read your confirmation letter you will note that housekeeping services, coffee, etc. cost extra. Your room is provided with a vacuum cleaner, washer/dryer, dishwasher etc. so you can do it yourself to save some money - or you can let the desk know you'd like services provided. Our rooms were clean, bright, and very large; just what you would expect from a resort condo. The kitchen was well-stocked with everything we needed to prepare meals, and there is a large Wal-Mart right around the corner for grocery shopping. Parking was secure and simple. If you are staying for an extended time in Orlando, I reccomend this place. We were too busy to enjoy the pool, but we checked out the facilities and they seemed very nice. A few hiccoughs: we opted for no maid service, and found it odd that the maid was still checking our condo (dirty towels would be removed, things tidied etc.) To avoid the confusion so many posters mention, the maid service agreement ought to be clearly posted in the rooms and listed in your reservation, as we eventually found it with other paperwork from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dannyboyxx123
Reviews.Content: I read nearly all the reports before going and can only say some people are either unlucky or fussy. I know rooms can have issues but from my trip which was my wife and myself, as managed to leave kids this time at home. We booked a 2 bedroom property as cheaper on website than a 1 bed !! Reception - good, very friendly, efficient and helpful. Had asked for upstairs rooms as read reports of noisy feet from above, so ended up with place with loft as games room - never to old to play. First impression was WOW and this grew during our 10 night stay. Kitchen had all we needed but eat out every day. Living room great with TV and DVD Loft had TV. Washing machine and dryer which we used to wash clothes and towels, towels were changed not daily but just as easy to put in wash as going out and then dry when got back. Main bedroon - huge bed which was really comfortable, en suite nice, walk in wardrobe with safe. 2nd bedroom - double and single , may have been a queen but didn't take any notice as put cases in here, had walk in wardrobe again. 2nd bathroom great. All very clean and comfortable and as we had some poor weather it was a pleasure to get back from dinner and chill in living room. Pool was very nice, towels are provided here so no problems, found very relaxing and plenty of shade. Resort fee as stated by others $5 per night but factor it in and still works out a good price for what you get. Walmart half a mile down road and big so good for shopping, LBV Shopping Outlet within a mile and as others state WDW approx 10 mins away. Later found that if I got onto SR 535 that made access to Crossroads and Orlando Premium Outlets really close as well. No doubts as to wheter we return, we will book this place again and planning to take family as checked out a 3 bed and same as 2 bed without walk in dressing in 2nd room which makes 3 rd bedroom which had double and single again all with TV's. Can't fault this place and we loved it. Any questions just ask and I'll try to answer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: G0Cards
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at the RBC in Aug. of 2007. The accomodations were fantastic! We stayed in a 1 bdrm. unit. It had a king sized master bedroom, walk-in closet, bathroom, and an open kitchen/dining room and living room. It also had a washer/dryer in a closet in the hallway, I first thought that was a waste b/c I don't want to do laundry on vacation, but we ended up using it quite a bit! It was more than enough room for the 4 of us. The kids loved the pool and basketball court. It was very clean and seemed pretty new, too. I would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a great bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time-Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: JudyCorn
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Runaway Beach Resort was above average. We had 5 adults and 2 children. We had a 3 bedroom with a loft. Loft area had a sofa sleeper, TV and fooseball table. Wasn't to sure about my 77 yr. old father climbing the stairs everyday, but from what I've read on other reviews, the 2nd floor is where you want to be., to avoid running children. Check in went rather smoothly. The first day/night was not great. Our A/C was not working, didn't have one of the channel changers, broken fooseball table and was missing a frying pan. Maintenance fixed the A/C when we were at dinner, brought another channel changer and fixed the fooseball table. No frying pan, though. Had to scramble eggs in a sauce pan. The unit was large, spacious and clean. For a person with a bad back, the beds slept great! Pool area was nice. My son and his friend enjoyed the half basketball court. Work out area was ok. A few broken machines. Pool area and hot-tub area was nice. Very pretty place to walk for exercise, around the lake. Overall, for the price, the condo was nice. In a 3 bedroom w/ loft unit, up to 14 people could have stayed there. The condo was very roomy. Easily affordable for 2 or 3 families. Grounds were kept neat. Location was good. Walmart across the street. Several restaurants within a mile from the resort. Outlets across street from Walmart. Convenience was a plus. In the future, we'd probably stay at the resort. Just plan to bring food, trash bags, toilet paper and supplies to wash clothes and dishes you'll be fine. I'd rather stay at a condo type resort than a hotel any day! For people who are very picky like me, I would recommend this place to stay while in Orlando. You should not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “beyond perfect”
Reviews.Author: miamimickey140
Reviews.Content: We went Aug 21st for 2 nights and had a 2 bdr suite. We had views of the lake/pool area Downstairs. I go to Disney about 4 times a year (2 of us) this time i took my parents who had not been in DIsney in30 years. I needed a bigger place...also my sister and nephew cam along. So staying on DIsney property or a regular room was not in the budget. THIS PLACE IS THE BEST. I would compare this to a Disney Vacation Home. LOCATION: Perfect...5 min to downtown disney and another 5 to any of the parks. Not far at all. Also close to shopping area and places to grab a bite. GROUNDS: Fantastic pool area. Lobby was inviting. And the service at check is was amazing. SUITE: It was beyond perfect. Clean and so much space. WE had 7 closets and 4 were walk in. Washer and dryer, full kitchen with all you need to cook and serve. TV in each room DVD in living area. Cable. The master room had a master bath with a roman round tub and all. Living room has 2 queensize sofa beds. King bed in mastr room, and Dble plus twin bed in second room. While walking the grounds...the employess always had a smile and said hello. The pool area is great. One kids pool with a semi-small water park type thing for them with fountains and so on. Then the adult pool was fantastic and hot tub. This is a fantastic place with fantastic service and a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ScottWC
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 6 days in Orlando, at the Runaway Beach Club condos. Our check in went very well, with very attentive staff, and a NO CHARGE upgrade to a 3 bedroom condo. The grounds are very well kept, and the pool area is wonderful for the family. Our condo was very nice. All 3 bedrooms had very comfortable beds, and there were 2 full baths as well. I had only 2 complaints about the room itself. First - they could have done a bit better when cleaning. We did a bit of touch up in the kitchen after arriving, but the bathrooms were great. The other issue did not really affect us - but the walls do seem to be very thin. We were there during the week, for the most part. But, on the final night (sat) when there were more people, it was easy to hear the people below and next to us. However, this happened in the morning as we were getting ready to go to Disney - so we were up anyway. There were NO problems at night. This is an EXCELLENT location - 10 mins from DIsney, and 15 from Sea World. There are MANY places to eat within 10 mins as well - in several directions. We shopped at a WalMart for basic supplies, which was very close and convenient. I would recommend this resort due to the price paid ($160 per night) - which is what some of the cheapest Disney hotels cost for a single room - not a 3 bedroom condo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!!! Would Def. Stay Here Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: melliewallace
Reviews.Content: This place is great! We loved it. The units are individually owned and they are really spacious. We are a family of four. Two adults, 1 child, and 1 infant...(actually the infant has more "gear" than anyone else LOL!) but we had PLENTY of room in a one bedroom unit. The closets are HUGE and the safe is really nice and we felt very secure leaving our valuables in it. The kitchen was great and had plenty of utensils; although we spent most of our time at Disney and Sea World; so we didn't really use it to cook. It was nice to have though; and if we we had stayed longer, it would've been great. The pool area was very nice and the kid pool was a terrific spot for my daughter to play. We even went to the park late one day so she could play in it. The whole pool/deck area was so nice and they played the best music. We didn't experience any problems at all with the front desk staff. They were extremely pleasant and very helpful. One even pulled up a ticket location (where we bought tickets and had to pick them up) on Mapquest for us while we were checking in. I only have one negative. There was a small stain on the comforter, sheet and pillow in the bedroom. (It looked like a coffee stain.) Luckily, there was an extra set of sheets and I just changed them myself and used another pillow. Since we weren't in the unit that much, I didn't bring it to the attention of management. I'm sure they would have corrected it if I had. However; everything else in the unit was sparkling clean, including the bathroom. Oh, and the bed...one of the most comfortable beds I have EVER slept on...not sure if it was a Tempur Pedic or Dux, but it was sooooooooooooo comfy! My husband travels for business and only stays at 5 stars...like Four Seasons, etc... He said this bed rivaled any at the Ritz Carlton, etc. The layout is a little strange, as this "community" is part of the greater unit of Calypso Cay. I was told (by another guest) that since the units are privately owned, some residents live there year round. I would def. stay here again withough hesitation and I would certainly recommend it to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: hdsMemphis
Reviews.Content: - easy check in - $5 / day resort fee not charged by website - the room I booked was unavailable so they upgrade me for free - clean room. No regular house cleaning other than new towels and taking out the garbage eveyday. - kiddy pool and adult pool were clean and quiet - Location cannot be any better / Disney is 5 minutes away, Walmart across the street and restaurants near by - worth the price / I will always check this property first when I go back to Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: pjmtCalgary
Reviews.Content: The best in Kissimmee! We stayed there two times during our vacation in August. Both times we got one bedroom suite with really spacious kitchen and large bathroom. We had a pretty view on the lagoon and pool.The place is very well maintained, there is a washer and dryer in the suite. The pools are very nice with abundance of loungers. There is free internet access in the lobby. Also we had a very good experience with the front desk. This place is very close to Disney. I would recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for extended families”
Reviews.Author: Gin505
Reviews.Content: We were 13 people from 6 months to 60 and everyone had room to move around. The washer came in handy we did a couple of loads a day. The pool is open to 11PM which made it nice when you came back from the parks. It was nice to have a full kitchen so we did not have to eat every meal out. Our refrigerator did not work when we got there and maintanence took care of the problem quickly. The kids loved the loft my son brought his WII and they had a place to themselves to play games while the rest of us had the living room and kitchen area to visit. We would definatly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value home from home accomodation”
Reviews.Author: NotNowBernard
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 week holiday in Florida. Our first week was at the Runaway Bay Resort, had I know that this place was going to be so great we never would have travelled down to Naples for a chill out after our hectic week in the theme parks. The runaway bay is a home away from home, it is well equipt with every thing you need for a self catering holiday, we didn't even bother to eat out for breakfast and even cooked a few evening meals in (something i usually refuse to do). The pool area we got round to using on our last day is perfect for chillin and there are more than plenty of shaded and sunny loungers to choose from. The children’s pool was perfect for my 8 year old. My 14 year old was disappointed to discover an indoor basketball court on the day we were leaving so he could not use it. If you are looking for a good quality, great value place to stay, to visit theme parks from, but are looking to get away from the Disney/Universal experience after hectic long days in the parks, this place has got to go on your short list, it is a great place that is only a short drive away from all the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Runaway Beach Club is great!!!”
Reviews.Author: TMPetrou
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and another couple rented a 1 bedroom w/ a loft condo at the Runaway Beach Club. Where I have heard that others had problems with the front desk, we experienced none. I wouldn't call their service there "a knockout"...but it definitely wasn't bad. I'll try to give an "all-inclusive" review. Check-in/out: Speedy, friendly, no problems. They didn't include any extras, but it was pleasant. Property: Large and in charge. :) The property is very clean, very quiet, and very nice. Good landscaping. We didn't use the pool or exercise room, but they both looked sufficient. Rooms: Clean, spacious, GREAT kitchen. The room was large, the loft was large. Would easily sleep 8 people. The pull-out couches were actually fairly comfortable!! They do not replace towels. But you have a washer and dryer... Use 'em! My only complaint is that there was only 1 trash can in the whole place, and it was a 1/2 size one. I really think if you are going here expecting a nice condo, with a lot of space, and a good kitchen, you will be pleased. It's not 5-star, but it's pretty sweet. It's in a very close distance to Disney, Universal, and the outlet malls. If you have any questions, please send me an email! TMPetrou@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: deseh
Reviews.Content: The resort is so colorful and it felt just like home!! It was kept so clean, the kiddie pool was awesome, kids loved it. Also had an adult pool. Keep in mind that the kiddie pool closes at dusk so you'll need to move to the "adult" pool, which is only 5 ft deep, so it's not bad! Lots of seating at the pool, and Friday night they have movies at the pool for the kiddies! The one bedroom we had was great, had all the comforts of home. We washed our laundry and put the trash out front for pickup, so it wasn't necessary for maid service. I really didn't mind. It's close to everything! Disney was like 10 minutes away, gatorland 10 minutes, downtown disney 10 minutes, seaworld maybe 20 minutes. I was told there would be laundry detergent, dish soap, etc. but there wasn't any of that. Small vials of shampoo and soap was all. There is a walmart within walking distance though so no big deal! We got locked out of our room, during a storm, and some staff on a golf cart were nice enough to let us in with their master key, then go get us new keys and bring them back to our door, even after their first "new" set didn't work either. They were great!! Called on Friday to notify us that the friday movie had been canceled due to the storm. We just had a great visit. You'll need to bring dish soap, food of course, we had to bring pepper....but it's a great place. Kids loved it. We had a baby and 3 kids with us, luckily both couches were pullout! Upon leaving we were given a 15% off coupon for our next reservation, I highly recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, spacious and convenient”
Reviews.Author: skeeziks
Reviews.Content: We really liked it here. We had a 2BDRM 2 BATH villa that was extremely clean, very spacious, well equipped, and attractively decorated. The beds were very comfortable and the unit had 4 TVs...plenty to avoid fights over what to watch. There was also loads of storage space including multiple large walk in closets. The full size washer and dryer also came in handy. The pool/lake area was very nice and the staff was helpful and accomodating. We were arriving early from a cruise ship and there was no problem at all checking in early. The location is convenient to all the parks/attractions and there are plenty of places to eat and shop in the immediate area. I would advise trying to get a room away from the highway. There was quite a lot of road noise in our master bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Really great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: parmancrane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort this past weekend for 2 nights and were quite impressed. We expected to like it because of the reviews we read, but like it better than we hoped and will certainly plan to stay again. We had booked a 1 br. apartment, but when I checked in the girl gave me a total that was twice the rate I'd agreed to. I pointed this out to her and she immediately adjusted my total to the agreed amount. Apparently they had run out of the type of room we had reserved and had upgraded us and she had almost accidentally charged us for the upgrade. When we got to the room, it was twice as big as we expected. A large living room with 2 pull out couches, a full kitchen w/ granite counter tops, dining area, master suite with king sized bed and garden tub in bathroom, full sized washer dryer, additional bedroom with a full size and single bed in it, walk-in closets in both rooms, another big bathroom, plus 3 large flat screen tv's and a Dvd player with the tv in living room. Very nice, comfortable, clean apartment. Our only regret is that we did not get to spend more time in it to enjoy it. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints!”
Reviews.Author: msruthie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 days in August. The staff was fine. As advised by the other reviews, I requested a room away from the road and on the second floor. We were supposed to be in a 1 bedroom loft, but were upgraded to a 2 bedroom 2 bath. Plenty of room. Our kids liked the pool area. Being so close to Walmart was a plus! I agree with some others that daily housekeeping would be nice. Great location!!! You should book directly through them because I got an excellent rate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Mikes New place”
Reviews.Author: sunshinegirl0707
Reviews.Content: I travel to Orlando frequently with daughters and granddaughter (6 yrs old) Have stayed in most of disney's resorts and outside of park. Found Mike Ditka's new resort on line. All i can say was wonderful. We had a 2 bedroom 2 bath villa. fully loaded, flat screen tv in each room. spa tub in master. king size bed/ one twin and one full in the second bedroom. living room had 2 queen pull out sofas. Very easy to get to off Oseola Parkway. Great price for all you get. Clean, beautiful decor. had indoor basketball, gym. 2 pools one for the little ones. the adult pool was small but that was the only issue. will go back in december for our Mickeys' xmas party vacation M Pontecorvi Lake Worth, Fla

Reviews.Title: “Checked back out and went elesewhere”
Reviews.Author: topsail123
Reviews.Content: When I checked in, I was put in a unit at the back corner of the property - even though I asked if I could be closer to the pool- Long walk to the pool - easier to drive up to that end. It was not what I expected - no views from that location. If you want to stay there, make sure you are up front near the pool - I found a better place to stay and checked back out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Getaway and Relax”
Reviews.Author: danielstrent
Reviews.Content: My Stay at Runaway Beach Club was very enjoyable from the moment I checked in until I checked out. I was visiting Florida for just a weekend with my wife and baby and we had a great time. The staff was very welcoming and when we needed directions they were very helpful and even printed out a map for us. The pool area at this resort is so colorful and full of life with a lot of room so it didn't feel crowded. The rooms are very spacious and very comfortable, it's a home away from home at a great price. Another thing I really like is that the resort has a gated entrence and they have a security guard that drives around the property 24 hours a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the value”
Reviews.Author: eyemabajan
Reviews.Content: Our party consisted of 3 adults, 3 children (16 and under) and 2 toddlers. The condo was an excellent value for the price. We had a two bedroom unit which had a king bed in the master room, two double beds in the second room, and two pull out sofa beds. It was clean, with all the amenities of home, close to all the theme parks, as well as to many different shops/restaurants/markets etc. The staff was friendly and helpful. We had an issue with a leak from the a/c unit which was taken care of by the maintenance staff. We would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: Evannava
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Orlando. We were five adults staying in a two bedroom condo at Runaway Beach and we found the resort to be an excellent value for the price. Master bedroom had king size bed and other bedroom had two full beds. We found the condo very clean with spacious bedrooms, living room and kitchen. Eating area a little small but acceptable. Could use another chair in the living room though. Very convenient to Universal Studios and Super Wal-Mart right around the corner. Heated pool was great and hot tub was relaxing. Only suggestion is they need more pots and pans in the kitchen for cooking. Would definitely stay again but would bring additional pots and pans.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful End to Hectic Days”
Reviews.Author: Auria-Sayuri
Reviews.Content: Runaway Beach Club Resort is a home away from home. The four of us stayed in a two bedroom/ two bath condo. We could have actually housed four more people with the two queen pull out sofas. We were very satisfied with our 8 night stay here. The accomodations are absolutely wonderful. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: busterbn2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here early in June. First of all we found out that we could have booked the room cheaper by calling them directly (not on-line) than by using Orbitz but it was still very reasonable. This is a condo community. We used the washer and dryer DAILY. Had a full kitchen with cookware and dishes. Full walk-in closet. Two flat screen TV's. Very comfy king bed with duvet and lots of pillows. Pool looked very inviting but we were so busy we didn't get a chance to use it. It's closely located to Sea World, Disney, and Universal but not too close. Wal-mart is just around the corner. Had originally booked this for half of our vacation and the other half at a much more expensive Marriott. We ended up canceling the Marriott and stayed the entire time at the Runaway. The only downfall is that if you need daily maid service, you'll be disappointed. This is your home away from home. You have to carry out the trash, make your own beds, etc. We were supplied with extra linens to change the bed when we requested them. The staff was all willing to help in any way we asked. It was a GREAT stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: sagfire5
Reviews.Content: My family and I were looking for a nice and comfortable place to stay to accomodate 6 adults, and 2 kids. I came across the Runaway Beach Resort online and it seemed to be too good to be true for the price. When we called the hotel, directly, the price was even less than the price shown online. I checked the reviews on tripadvisor and it got very good reviews, so we decided to book it. We stayed in a two bedroom loft and boy was it comfortable!! It was very spacious, a modern kitchen, 3 sofa beds, a TV in the loft, in the livingroom and in the two bedrooms, washer and dryer. I must say it was a great stay! The pool was also very nice, the kiddie pool was too. They had nice music playing and you just felt like you were on an island vacationing. The only complain that I have is that they did not have extra sheets and pillows for the sofa beds, and not very many towels. Other than that I totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Treasure for an Unbelievable Price!”
Reviews.Author: fourgibbonsinmd
Reviews.Content: After spending seven nights at the Dolphin, a deluxe hotel on Disney property, we needed a place to stay for one additional day in Orlando. We chose a two bedroom w/ loft at the Runaway Beach Club. We paid quite a bit more for a small, yet nice, room with no kitchen and an even smaller bathroom at the Dolphin. So, we were a little skeptical when the cost at the Runaway Beach Club was almost $60. p/ night less than at the Dolphin. Wow! We were not disappointed. It was very clean and spacious, with a beautiful kitchen, two large bathrooms, free wireless internet access, and four televisions! The new pool was gorgeous and the staff was very friendly and helpful. This resort is located across from a fabulous deluxe name brand shopping outlet and is less than ten minutes from Disney World. A few suggestions: For a quiet and cozy retreat, make sure to request to be located away from the main road--very tranquil and tucked away! Also, for added privacy, request a second floor suite. One last tip, if you are traveling with older kids or teens, it is absolutley worth the extra $10-$15 p/ night for the loft. Our 11 & 13 year olds loved having their "own space" in addition to their bedroom. The price and amenities are unbeatable. This is absolutely a hidden treasure! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveably beautiful and close to DISNEY!”
Reviews.Author: DocRockford_IL
Reviews.Content: OK, the place is gorgeous. No doubt about that. The price is low right now because it is new. Stay there before it goes up due to rising demand and reputation. Even at a higher price, it would be great to stay here again, but the low price is great!! The sun deck is awesome, and I will post some of the best photos I took while there. Even better, they are putting in a restaurant in the near future. However, there are ample restaurants and Walmart right down the street. It's only a few minutes from Disney and they even have a shuttle service!! TIP: Stay in one of the upstairs condos. The floors and walls aren't paper-thin, but many people have kids and just the normal activity can transfer sound through the floors. If you are upstairs this won't matter to you at all. Most of all, have fun!! Oh yes, and I]m not sure if this has yet been mentioned, but there's a really nice kiddie pool next to the main pool. It's great!

HotelInfo.Name: Mike Ditka Resorts Runaway Beach Club
HotelInfo.Address: 3000 Bonfire Beach Dr., Kissimmee, FL 34746
